instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Pinot' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: First impressions: The rice from this cooker is delicious and the process was very simple after discovering that long-grain rice, which is what I eat, is the exception rather than the rule for this cooker.  On the Quick Start Guide, a single sheet added to the enclosed paperwork,  (and not anywhere in the manual that I could find) it states that the cooker is designed for short and medium grain rice.  The Quick Start Guide says that long-grain rice should be cooked using the Mixed rice setting.  Fine, except that in the smaller print of the operating manual it says that the Timer function, which I'd like to use, is not available for Mixed rice.  So if I want to use the Timer I will either have to switch  to small/medium grain rice or find a White rice setting that works equally well.  According to the manual, Mixed rice requires about 30 minutes of pre-heating time, so that must be the requirement for long grain rice.I was also disappointed to find that if and when the battery needs to be replaced it is not a simple DIY operation.  Videos of owners attempting to replace the battery themselves (not recommended by the manufacturer) show total disassembly of the cooker and the very careful, precise use of a soldering iron and other tools to replace the battery which is soldered directly to a printed circuit board.  For most owners this will no doubt require shipping their cooker to a repair facility just to replace a battery.  As I said, disappointing from a design standpoint.  Battery life is estimated at 4-5 years if the unit is left unplugged.  Maybe at that point it will be time for a new cooker anyway, but I hope to get more years from this investment so I'll keep my unit plugged in to save the battery.I am very happy with the rice from this cooker and would not want to discourage anyone from purchasing this fine product.  It is easy to use, easy to clean and has produced excellent servings of rice for me.  I did want to point out a couple things that I was not aware of prior to purchase.Update #1After some experimentation I find that I can make wonderful long grain rice using the White rice setting.  I start by thoroughly rinsing the rice in the excellent Oxo rice washing colander until the water is clear.  To cook I use a ratio of 1 water to 1 rice using the cup included with the cooker to measure both which is slightly less water than using the line on the bowl.  The result is rice with separate grains instead of stickier rice.  I tried using medium grain rice but that does produce a sticky rice that is perfect for chopsticks but not what I usually want.  Using the White rice setting has also allowed me to use the Timer function which is very useful.Update #2It's been a couple months now.  I've continued to experiment with the water amount and the settings.  I find that I can get the exact texture of rice I want by using the amount of water indicated by the lines on the bowl along with the White Rice - SOFTER setting.  This seems to work perfectly for both long-grain and medium-grain rice.  I've also made yellow rice, substituting chicken broth for water and adding some spices prior to cooking, also using the SOFTER setting.  It's great.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Mac' to comment on the product 'Presto 05411 GranPappy Electric Deep Fryer'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 51.03; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Fryers:Deep Fryers'.
output: Real Pleased With The Thing: It seems to hold the temperature at a good spot for French fries and corn dogs. Simple, basic, don't have to mess with it, just plug it in and it works! When the oil gets lots of crud in it from the stuff your frying, heat the oil to about 100F. degrees, and filter it through a paper towel (Viva paper towel worked better) I put the paper towel in my spaghetti strainer and set the strainer over a good sized soup kettle. 4 minutes later pure oil filtered through to the pan with no crud in it. Wipe out the fryer and pour the oil back in. Ready for more tasty French fries! I used peanut oil and it worked great!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Amazon Customer' to comment on the product 'Waring Pro Professional Meat Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 320.0; Brand: Waring; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Food Grinders & Mills:Meat Grinders'.
output: Great way to cook for my diet plan!: Pretty happy with the way the Waring works, I had ordered the Rival grinder for about 68 dollars before this one, and had to return it because of how discolored the cutting plate turned (it looked like a streak of oil in a puddle of water) and rust was developing, even though I dried it everytime.In the Waring pro, all the moving parts are made of stainless steel, and quite dense too.  There is a plastic ring in the metal tube that connects to the motor, I guess plastic is the ideal material for that particular spot.  (it looks like a washer) I don't really know what it does though. For my diet, I have to eat 3-4 oz of chicken breasts  4 times a day, I used to get so tired of eating flavorless chicken.  Now I just ground up all the chicken breasts and make a delicious, healthy and hearty chili.  The flavors get into every bit of the ground chicken.  The texture and looseness of the ground chicken is just easier for me to swallow the food and stick to my diet.No problems with clogging yet even though I ran some pork butt and pork belly (which is like 50% fat) through it to make sausages for my friend, I do put the blade and plate and other metal parts beside the hopper into the freezer for about 20 mins before I use it, and partially freeze the meats too, as many tips have suggested.I am taking 1 star off because my food pusher arrived broken in two pieces, but thank goodness it wasn't too important of a part of the machine so I just kept it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'D. P.' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Cooks Rice with little effort: This thing is expensive for what it does. If you cook a lot of rice fairly frequently, it might be a good purchase. Was concerned a bit about capacity, but it's more than enough for meals for a family of four. You will want to hand wash the inner pan. The serving scoop / rice fluffer is useful and easy to clean. Have used only on the Pre-Washed setting and it took a couple of runs before we got the rice:water ratio just right, but once dialed in, the result is consistent - evenly cooked rice with an excellent texture. I have previous experience cooking rice in a general-purpose steamer, and this is a solid step up in terms of simplicity, and a minor step up in terms of the quality of its output. Keep warm function does a good job keeping the rice from drying out, but typically use this only for 1-2 hours max, so can't attest to longer periods. I have noticed recently that the unit will trap some moisture in the lid above the seal (where the steam vents) and this did cause some worry when water leaked out and we initially could not tell where it was coming from. Overall, if you are determined to buy a rice cooker, this is a good (expensive) option.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'R. W. Pochciol' to comment on the product 'Aroma Housewares ASP-137 Grillet 3Qt. 3-in-1 Cool-Touch Electric Indoor Grill Portable, Dishwasher Safe, 3-Quart, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 31.1; Brand: Aroma Housewares; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Grills'.
output: Best camper kitchen appliance: I've made burgers, hot dogs, bacon & scrambled eggs, potstickers, stir fry, tacos, barbeque chicken and much more in this cooker over the past 3 years. Like electric skillets, the heating coil is either full on or full off, but the temp control knob with indicator light lets you select the best cooking temp. The heating coil cycles on & off, as does the temp selection indicator light. The metal pot is approx 8" at the bottom and 10" at the top and has 3 rests to keep the lid elevated about 1/16" to prevent steam buildup inside. There's still enough steam for stir fry and potstickers. The grill lines keep bacon and burgers from sitting in grease. The removable pot cleans easily and quickly, and clicks into the plastic base. The base stays cool while cooking but the counter surface below can get very warm. I can't say enough good things about this cooker! Easy clean up, so versatile and portable which is awesome for camping. It's lightweight and stores easily in the camper. I lined the pot to protect the non stock surface from scratches while the cord is stored inside.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Nicole Raje' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. output: Out of control juicer: I cannot stand this juicer. I spent $300 on it (which I think is on the high end for a small appliance with literally only ONE function) and it's just lived in my cabinet for the past several years because I absolutely HATE it. First off, it's messy and labor intensive to clean. You know a product is going to be high maintenance when comes with its own special cleaning tools (cleaning brush was included). Pulp ends up everywhere (even when properly assembled). Also, it easily gets thrown off balance and will literally start jumping around on the counter and you have to hold it down with two hands while someone else puts the ingredients in and pushes them down with the plunger. One time, it even projectile shot an entire lemon wedge back out which hit the kitchen ceiling. Oh, and it sounds like an airplane taking off.... it will literally wake up everyone in the house. DO NOT BUY.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'H. McKee' to comment on the product 'BLACK+DECKER G48TD Waffle Maker, 3-in-1, Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 69.99; Brand: BLACK+DECKER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: Does not cook evenly.: I bought this to replace one I got 40 years ago....same one, only it was made by GE back then. It was the electric cord that finally degraded that made me have to replace it. I was so happy with it, that I was thrilled to see they still made one just like it. This new one does NOT cook evenly. The bottom is hotter than the top. On the TOP the front is hotter than the back. So a waffle can look "perfect" on the top of the two front waffles, while looking "not quite done" on the top of the back two, while looking "overdone" when you flip them over to see the bottom side. Very disappointed. I will probably replace this one within the year with a DIFFERENT make/model.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Tom Bryant' to comment on the product 'Hamilton Beach DrinkMaster Electric Drink Mixer, Restaurant-Quality Retro Milkshake Maker & Milk Frother, 2 Speeds, Extra-Large 28 oz. Stainless Steel Cup, Classic Chrome'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Hamilton Beach; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Mixers:Stand Mixers'.
output: Still the same model after all these years. Update.: My old one (exact same model) lasted nearly 40 years with nearly daily use for mixing a morning protein shake. It made a rough noise and the rpm dropped drastically so I figured it was used up. This new one is chrome, instead of black, but otherwise the same. It has suction cup feet on the bottom instead of just rubber pads being the only difference. My old beater and cup fit perfectly so I have spares and can make 2 drinks without washing the cup out. I expect this one to last a long time too. Time will tell.UPDATE!I'm sad to say that this new mixer was a disappointment. I expected it to be as good as the original I had for decades but right out of the box it had a bad vibration. I inspected it to see if anything was loose and also compared it with the old one including using the beater from the old one. Same result. Bad vibration and loud running. It could have been a one-time deal but since it vibrated at first power up, I have to assume it was not tested after assembly or the tester didn't care. I returned it for a refund. Amazon was amazingly fast with the refund. As soon as the UPS driver picked it up and scanned it in, my card was credited. Thanks Amazon.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Myriam' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Worth every dollar: Things I like: it cooks rice evenly, come out perfectly fluffy everytime. It's easy to use, has a spoon holder and a handle (two things I didn't know I needed on a rice cooker), it keeps rice warm without burning the bottom of the pot, the inside lid is easy to remove and put back on.Bonus: sings a song when rice is ready.The one thing I don't like: the price. Let's be honest, no one likes spending that much on small kitchen appliances. It's like paying 200$ for a toaster. Sounds insane. But sometimes it's worth paying a bit more to have a quality product that will last a long time. I bought 5 Black&Decker rice cookers at canadian tire over the course of 6 years (30$ each) and 4 of them stopped working after less than a year. Instead of wasting so much money on a cheap model, I should've bought this one from the start.Bottom line: Love it, worth it, just buy it?

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Riwan Khalil' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Food Processor, Mini-Prep 3 Cup, 24 oz, Brushed Chrome and Nickel, DLC-2ABC'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 39.95; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Food Processors'.
output: Super Creamy Hummus!: I don't usually write reviews but this little food processor is a beast! I have a Hamilton Beach processor (don't judge me), a ninja blender, two different types of immersion blenders and I swear, this little Cuisinart food processor can take the place of everything else I own. I was making hummus in my Ninja blender and not getting a smooth consistency so I moved it over to the mini Cuisinart and it came out creamy and perfect! Also was trying to make falafel in the Hamilton Beach processor and the consistency was so chunky, even after letting it grind for a few minutes. So I moved it to the mini Cuisinart and it grinded way finer, allowing me to form falafel balls without falling apart. Anyway, this little guy is amazing!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Aaron E. Doughty' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: BUY THIS MACHINE!!!: I've had this machine for quite some time now.  My friend who does extensive researcher prior to any purchase had purchased one and highly recommended it.  It cooks rice perfectly EVERY TIME.  It keeps the rice warm and moist for hours after cooking without burning it.  It does take quite a bit of time to cook (approx 45 min for white rice) but can be cut down to 30 minutes with the 'quick cooking' option or can be planned ahead and programmed with the timer.  The machine is also very expensive but is 100% worth the cost for the quality of rice and ease of use.  I took an evening class at Johnson & Wales to learn to make sushi and in all honesty this machine produced a high quality rice than their machine.  I can not praise this machine enough.  It is the best purchase I've made in years.  My favorite part is the wonderful smell that fills my kitchen while I cook Jasmine rice.  I've even made Creme Brulee in it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'maou' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Teflon coming off less than a year later... DO NOT purchase!: Summary: DO NOT buy this rice cooker.Zojirushi rice cookers have been famously known as being the best rice cookers out there. I invested in one thinking this was the undeniable truth. Unfortunately, for a nearly $200 rice cooker, this was not the case.I have had the same rice cooker since my family moved to the USA in 1986 and it still works great. It's a cheap Oster rice cooker that never burns rice and always cooks it perfectly. Other cookers I've bought have never panned out, so I always went back to my Oster. My parents came over one weekend to visit and were surprised that I was still using the old Oster and bought this Zojirushi for me from Amazon that same night. It arrived 2 days later thanks to Prime and has been an excellent rice cooker.Being an investment, I took great care of it... I washed it with a soft wash cloth and used minimal, mild soapy water (per directions). Less than a year later (approximately 9 months), I notice the Teflon has begun to come off the bottom. I NEVER us any other utensil other than the provided rice scooper to remove rice from the cooker.It's so disappointing that a highly touted rice cooker has worn faster than a 30 year old rice cooker. I will NEVER buy a Zojirushi rice cooker again and am going back to my old, but reliable Oster rice cooker from 1986.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'C. C.' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: 5 years and counting...PERFECT RICE EVERY TIME: I've had this rice cooker for about 5 yrs now and I've never once had a problem with it. It tells time even when it's unplugged and I haven't had to change the clock battery yet. As far as the rice making capabilities of this cooker, I really don't think it could get any better. I also used the programmable time function quite a bit when I was working nights. Add the rice and water to the cooker and press a few buttons to have freshly made rice at the same time my alarm clock was going off in the afternoon. When I initially bought it, it was because I could never make a decent batch of rice. Since then I've been cooking all kinds of rice in this cooker and it always turns up perfectly. That's because all I do now is add my ingredients and press a button and this really smart cooker does all the work. The price is high and hasn't changed much in about 5 years (in fact I think I paid the same for it, about $180), but if mine broke I would buy another one just like it in a heartbeat.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Sadie' to comment on the product 'Aroma Housewares ASP-137 Grillet 3Qt. 3-in-1 Cool-Touch Electric Indoor Grill Portable, Dishwasher Safe, 3-Quart, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 31.1; Brand: Aroma Housewares; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Grills'.
output: This may be my most used appliance: I live in a desert, where appliance cooking makes total sense.  Because I take pains to avoid adding unnecessary heat to our cottage for most of the year, I have gone through a a variety of electric skillets and Foreman grills, in search of the just-right-for-my-style-of-cooking-appliance.None have been completely satisfactory, for one reason or another, but this Aroma mult-pot is almost perfect in all the important ways.I bought it as  a warehouse deal, knowing I was taking a chance.  Who among us has not received a broken or defective product returned by some earlier buyer?  But the price was low enough that I was willing to gamble.Sure enough, the pot arrived with a the broken plastic housing on the control plug, but it was nothing a dab of epoxy glue couldn't fix.  I was too eager to put it to work to be arsed to send it back.It has been used almost daily since then.  It  is much more versatile than a panini press type grill and a perfect  size for a two-person household. Last night I grilled some burgers and then browned chicken cubes for tonight's chicken verde.  I cooked up a mess of bacon in it this morning. I'll make braised escarole and beans tomorrow night and grilled cheese sandwiches the next. It will be used for a Halloween houseparty hotpot at the end of this month.This is how I  know I have found a really "good," or, at least, good-for-me appliance...something about it encourages it's frequent use. This three-in-one superpot is my new favorite in that regard. Move on over, egg cooker/single serve broccoli steamer!Some reviewers say  these are "flimsy" appliances,  but they are judging this pot by its cover. Yes, the surrounding frame is plastic, but it is not likely to break unless it is severely abused.  It is advertised as being dishwasher proof but it is easier to wipe it down after each use.The cooking portion is a snap to remove and replace and (relatively) easy to clean.  I also appreciate the indicator light on the dial, which makes it easy to fine tune low temperature cooking. The overall temperature control is very responsive, with the unit heating up and cooling down quickly and the non-stick finish is superb.But the top selling point (Grill Marks!) is also  my top gripe. Those luscious bown marks come from ridges. Ridges make it difficult to spatula out leftover grease, and demand the melt and pour method of cleaning, vs. the scrape and dunk method.  Being firmly in the former camp, I want this with a flat bottom pan, and a removable ridged insert for the occaisional times when really want  Grill Marks!  I would even pay full price for it.But until then, I will just have to make do with my nearly almost perfect Grillette. Life is tough, I tell ya.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Local' to comment on the product 'Presto 05420 FryDaddy Electric Deep Fryer,Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 37.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Fryers:Deep Fryers'.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Lifeslillessons' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: It heats beautifully, is non-stick: I got this for my husbands birthday since he loves fondue, but I didn't want to pay an arm and a leg to do it at a restaurant anymore. It heats beautifully, is non-stick, and there is plenty of room for two people to constantly have something finishing up with many more in queue. I love that there are indentations to evenly space the "spears"and keep them from moving around so you don't lose track of the order you put them in. Colors help you remember what was on each stick. Only complaints are: I wish the cord was a bit longer, but it's not ridiculously short either and I don't believe there is a way to detach the pot form the base and I feel wierd washing it with the heating element and power cord input still attached. All in all though, great product and I would buy again!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'The Dainty Flower' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Eh, Just Mediocre: I consider myself to be a fondue expert.  I've eaten fondue all over the world in all sorts of venues.  I love to make it at home and usually enjoy it immensely.  Fondue should be an experience, not just a meal.  I have other Cuisinart products, and am happy with them all.  This one, not so much.  First, it's enormous.  At three quarts, you need to feed at least six to eight people to get the liquid in the pot to cover whatever it is you are fondue-ing.  I prefer a little more of an intimate setting.  Next, the temperature settings aren't very true.  There's a point between 3 and 3.5 where the heat goes from a gentle simmer to a raging boil, and there's no in-between.  Very difficult get the meat to the temp you want when you never know what the temp is actually going to be.  Lastly, the cord for this unit is about a foot long at best.  I don't know of anyone who has a plug directly on their table or likes to eat next to a wall just to get an outlet.  I had to use an extension cord, and the weight of the cord kept pulling the plug out of the pot and making it slowly sneak off the table.  Bad situation all around.  I guess what I'm trying to say is that this baby is going back and I'm going to look for something a bit more stable.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Pittsburgh girl' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: the best thing in my kitchen!: My husband and I usually go to The Melting Pot once a year, but considering it is on average $100 + tip for 2 people, it seemed like we could recreate it at home.  And we did!  We looked up a website which is called "f*** yeah melting pot... because the restaurant is way too expensive" after googling "the melting pot recipes".  i wrote down the spinach artichoke recipe and we went to Publix and found EVERY ingredient (despite the website saying we might have to substitute with commonly found ingredients).  We both agreed it was so much better than the actual restaurant!  the only problem would be finishing the cheese/bread part, then having to clean it out to start the broth for the main meal.  also, it heated up very fast so it was hard to tell which temperature to pick.  we need more practice, but we can't wait.  we ended up just standing there in the kitchen using our hands and pieces of bread.  i can't wait to have company and use it!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Mid-Century Todd' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Whatever "Neuro Fuzzy" is, it works: I got this rice cooker to replace an identical one I got a decade ago. The old one still worked perfectly, but I moved it to a vacation home, so I needed another for my home. While it's more expensive than other similar ones, I knew from experience that whatever "fuzzy logic" this rice cooker uses to cook rice, it works perfectly every time, even if you might get the water-to-rice mix wrong, or put something else in with the rice, or whatever.  The non-stick pan is more than easy to clean. The rice comes right out and you toss it in the dishwasher. You get what you pay for and it's worth it.

output: Great for table top BBQ: For the price, this is a really good table top BBQ grill. It get's truly hot and the temp control works well. The size we ordered is perfect for two people, but for a larger family, this may be to small. We have used it several times for the likes of Korean BBQ, grilling a steak and grilling chicken with accompanying vegetables and all turned out well. Operationally, it is perfect, but my only negative is cleaning it. While the grilling surfaces are non-stick and clean up easily, it really can't be submerged or have any running water on the bottom part. But, the temp control unplugs and is separate from the unit for cleaning, so a little water is not going to hurt the main section.

output: I like to juice in bulk to save time/my sanity but ...: I have never had a messier experience juicing than I have with this model. We literally have to wipe down every surface around the juicer every time as the motor is almost TOO power and spits juice/debris everywhere from all angles. I like to juice in bulk to save time/my sanity but the pitcher provided is so small and the hole in the side for the spout makes it even smaller. Because of how powerful the motor is on High it shoots out in a way that won't allow for the use of any other pitcher than the teeny one provided and it also creates a crazy amount of foam. For the first 6 months to 1 year the pros outweighed the cons but after a year of use the cons are finally outweighing the pros and I'm now on the search for a new juicer.

output: Purchased this 12 years ago and it's still working!: I looked back to see when I purchased this fabulous rice cooker.  12 years ago!  I'm amazed. I see there's another model that has a cake feature.  I wanted a Korean rice cooker at one time and thought that I'll just wait until this one gives out.  I do now wash my rice in a rice washing plastic bowl I purchased at Daiso for $1.50 to save the non-stick coating inside this pot.  Other than that it cooks wonderfully and keeps leftover rice warm for days.  I will always purchase zojirushi!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Jazz Castañeda ' to comment on the product 'Magic Bullet Blender, Small, Silver, 11 Piece Set'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 39.88; Brand: Magic Bullet; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Blenders:Countertop Blenders'.
output: Save Your Money -- This Blender Doesn't Blend: I've been replacing the cheapest blender at Target for years (every three years, to be exact). I thought this could be a great introduction to something a little nicer till I save up to buy a larger and even nicer blender. I'm used to throwing in frozen fruit, yogurt, spinach, and milk into the blender to have it blend while I get ready. With this blender you have to take it apart and stir it constantly for it to only get through HALF a smoothie and still very big frozen chunks. I tried several methods to no avail. I got so frustrated I threw it away after a couple of weeks (I had already used the blender and thrown away the box so didn't think I could return it). This was such a big waste of money. And for many mornings, a huge waste of time and discomfort (since I didn't have a full smoothie to consume while at work).

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'TwoSparrows' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Simply Amazing! (14 Years Later): This rice cooker makes the best rice we have ever had - at least since our travels to Southeast Asia.  And despite the fact that this machine *seems* smarter than it's user, it is remarkably simple to operate.  The instruction book lacks a little bit in terms of recipes and creativity - but it does a good job giving you the basic idea of how to use this machine.  This space age looking rice cooker is a little pricey, so it may be overkill for some - but I love all the features this offers and consider it well worth the price (which is a hundred less than what it is offered for here at Amazon).  We eat a lot of brown rice, which is not something that other rice cookers handle well.  This one has a setting for brown rice, and cooks it to perfection.  Also has a setting for semi-brown rice, sushi rice, porridge & more.  You get to pick how soft or hard you want the rice to turn out by using the control panel.  Being able to set a timer for having rice ready when we get home from work is handy.  This thing also cooks complete meals - definitely get a good cookbook for rice cooker cooking :-)  We are expirimenting with many varieties of rice that I normally would have shyed away from, since I could not seem to cook even plain old brown rice properly until now.It took me 6 months to decide to buy this thing.  We were originally contemplating the MYC10 series, but the specific settings for brown rice became important to us.  And this one takes up less space on the countertop than the MYC10.  We will be eating rice nearly every day now thanks to this machine!  I am definitely glad we chose the ZAC10, and would recommend this product.  It's a keeper!UPDATED JUNE 12, 2004:  We have now had this rice cooker for nearly a year, and have used it at least 3 times a week.  It has held up to regular use quite well, we have not had a single problem with it.  If anything, we are eating at home more than ever because of the simplicity of planning meals ahead of time.  One thing that we have learned is that the 5 cup capacity is for using the cooker for white rice.  Brown rice capacity is about 3 cups.  So if you anticipate using this for more than 3 6 oz. cups of dry brown rice, you might consider steppig up to the 10 cup capacity model ZAC18.  One tip for making very tasty rice, use a broth instead of water (or 1/2 and 1/2).  If you are on fence about this cooker go ahead and take the leap - it is fantastic!  No regrets!UPDATED April 18, 2008:  Well, the "Brown Rice" setting finally died this week after nearly five (yes FIVE!) faithful years of weekly use.  We remain very pleased with this product, and plan to upgrade to the newest model in a 10 cup capacity.UPDATED May 24, 2017:  We never discarded this after buying the newer 10 cup model. Hard to believe this rice cooker is as old as our youngest teenager and still gets regular use on the white rice setting!  The only setting that doesn't work is brown rice... and we use our larger 10 cup version for that. One of the best kitchen gadgets we have ever purchased!

output: Lowering Review to 1 Star: It leaves alot of juice in the dregs.  In one and a half cups of juice there's another third of a cup of juice in the dregs.  How do I know?  Well I scrape the dregs into a fine mesh bag and squeeze it into a cup.  Over time this is alot of juice lost in the dregs.  I've tried juicing slower but the result is the same.  The other thing that is a concern to me is that the machine must be off one minute for every one minute of use.  With these 2 issues I cannot recommend it and have not decided if I will keep it or not.Update:  I've had this juicer for 5 days now and it's leaking all over my kitchen counter.  Definitely returning it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Mister Blue Sky' to comment on the product 'Presto Poplite 04820 Popper, 1 Size, yellow'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 29.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Popcorn Poppers'.
output: Pop your way to happiness with the Presto Poplite: As a self-proclaimed popcorn enthusiast, I've tried my fair share of popcorn poppers over the years. But the Presto Poplite Popper has truly blown me away with its efficiency, convenience, and, most importantly, delicious popcorn!The first thing I noticed about this popper is its vibrant yellow color. It adds a fun and playful touch to my kitchen and never fails to put a smile on my face. But what really sets this popper apart is its lightning-fast popping speed. In just a few short minutes, I can have a full bowl of perfectly popped popcorn ready to go.One thing I appreciate about the Presto Poplite is its compact size. It doesn't take up much counter space, making it perfect for small kitchens or apartments. And when I'm done using it, the popper is easy to clean and store away.But let's talk about the popcorn itself. The Presto Poplite produces fluffy, evenly cooked popcorn every time. And because it uses hot air instead of oil, it's a healthier option for those watching their calorie intake. Plus, I love that I can control the amount of butter and seasoning I add to my popcorn, giving me endless flavor options.Overall, I highly recommend the Presto Poplite Popper to anyone looking for a fast, convenient, and delicious way to enjoy popcorn. Trust me, once you try this popper, you'll never go back to microwave popcorn again!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Adam R' to comment on the product 'Krups 652-70 OptiSteam Plus 2-Tier Steamer, DISCONTINUED'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 88.18; Brand: KRUPS; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Steamers'.
output: Reliable, works well: We've had two of these over the course of 4 years, which might not sound good, but we use it literally every single night, so that's over 700 uses at the max 1 hour setting for each unit. And the steamer itself still works after that time, but the plastic in the bottom-tier tub starts to break down and come apart, and it's as inexpensive to buy a new steamer as a new tub...I agree with another user's comment that the timer can't be turned backward and this is annoying. We only use it for rice however, and so we always turn the dial all the way around. We chose this steamer over conventional rice steamers because we *didn't* want it to keep the rice warm - it just shuts off. (We make rice every night before going to bed for our dogs' food - don't ask!) We haven't used it for veggies, so can't comment on the performance there, but it does a fine job on rice. Though it does take an hour, much longer than stove-top or dedicated rice-steamers. But for us it's a set-it and forget-it type of thing.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Rowan T. Mattox' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Excellent rice cooker: This is a fantastic little gadget. I use it primarily to cook basmati rice and steel-cut oats. My favorite feature is that I can set it to be ready-to-eat when I choose, meaning I can have hot oatmeal ready to eat first thing in the morning, or a pot of rice steamed for dinner in the evening. All it requires is a little planning ahead. The cord is retractable, and everything that comes with the rice cooker (save the manuals) fits neatly inside the rice cooker, making it portable and compact, great for a small kitchen.My minor complaints are that its internals are all hand-wash only, and that the steel-cut oatmeal is a little dense and drier than I would prefer straight from the pot when prepared as recommended. This is easily rectified with a splash of water or milk once removed from the cooker. Given that the pot is a very nice nonstick, washing it by hand isn't the worst thing. Rice and oatmeal come out very easily and with minimal, if any, scrubbing. This cooker does not have features for steaming vegetables or meat, which I don't find terribly detracting as I'd rather have a great one function device than an underperforming two function device. I also find that the "stay cool" handles aren't so much cool to the touch as cooler than the rest of the pot. The handles can be a bit unpleasantly warm to the bare hand, I don't feel these warrant taking off as star overall.For those who can afford this, I highly recommend this rice cooker, as the rice comes out great consistently and it has some really nice features. I also recommend keeping the original packaging for the rice cooker if you intend on moving frequently, or can't afford the counter space for the rice cooker all the time. Everything fits very compactly inside the unit, but the manuals and quick reference guides are immensely useful for taking the guesswork out of "which setting do I choose?", and having it inside its box makes it easy to both transport and store.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Teri' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: When it's good, it's very, very good, when it's bad, it's horrid: I got this rice cooker about 18 months ago when my older children left home and we needed a smaller rice cooker.  Love it!  Yes, it does boil over but if you put in a tablespoon of butter it only bubbles around the edge of the lid.  No problem making brown rice, never had a problem with it being dry on the bottom, no problem with the teflon.  One of the things I like best about it is that it's pretty much wipe and dry - so much easier to clean than the old aluminum cooker that had to be soaked for three hours.HOWEVER.  All of a sudden, two weeks ago, it stopped working.  Just stopped. The amber light would go on when it was plugged in, but the switch wouldn't go down to start the cycle.  Tried every outlet, yada yada yada.But hey!  It's got a warranty!  Yes.  They will replace it if it breaks within three years.Of course, you have to pay them $10 first or they won't ship it to you, and you have to pay to ship it back to them, so you're essentially just getting a discount on a new cooker.But then there's more!  The warranty on the new cooker - get this - goes to the end of the three years on the original purchase, not three years for the new cooker.  That is how unreliable they think their own product is.  They're really just renting it to you for three years.  I fully expect this replacement to last another 18 months, at which time I will read reviews before I buy a different brand.I was surprised, because my other Cuisinart products have not had any problems.  However, I don't use those every single day like I do the rice cooker.  I think this is made to be displayed with one's other chrome appliances, and not actually intended to be used to, you know, cook rice.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Shabnam' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Sing me the song of your people!: I love this thing. I'd been thinking about getting a Japanese rice cooker for awhile and was shopping around for different brands when I got the chance to take this for a test drive cooking at a relative's house. I had never made brown rice in my life, the owner of the cooker had lost both the instructions and the measuring cups, and the rice itself had no instructions on it either. Even totally winging it, this cooker produced perfect brown rice, so I was sold. Now I finally have my own and so far it has been amazing! Looks intimidating with all the different settings and markings, but it's really not so bad, and the fuzzy logic means you get perfect-for-you (depending on your settings) rice every time! I also LOVE that it sings when it starts and finishes the timer!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Perry' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: So disappointed!: Omega J8003 Nutrition Center Single-Gear Commercial Masticating Juicer, White, So many good reviews had me so anxious to start using this juicer. Some of the cons listed in different reviews where in fact too difficult to get past. What others called a small feed shoot is in fact very small. The extruded pulp was very wet and was able to squeeze considerable juice from it by hand. This particular unit did not live up to its reputation.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Anne B.' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Food Processor, Mini-Prep 3 Cup, 24 oz, Brushed Chrome and Nickel, DLC-2ABC'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 39.95; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Food Processors'.
output: Cuisinart Mini Prep Food Processor Brushed Chrome and Nickel: MISLEADING: The “brushed chrome and nickel” is cheap, colored plastic. I was in complete shock upon removing the mini processor from its packaging. Literal JUNK. I can’t imagine the blade chopping a single peanut, without it breaking the cup. Super flimsy. Where in the world did the quality of Cuisinart go? I have no idea how this small appliance received high reviews; unless, in the interim of those reviews and my purchase, manufacturing has changed. Additionally, no “how-to” pamphlet included which might be a fluke - or - something to consider for first-time small appliance users. No warranty card included either. Already filled out the form to return this product. You are better off shopping a brick and mortar store; and checking out these small appliances in person. Pay a little more and get something with substance. Extremely disappointed.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Amazon Customer' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Dangerous, shaky: I grew up w my mom juicing for the fam so I am familiar with the process. My bf bought this juicer bc we thought it would be a decent option. Super easy set up, nice heavy base. Looks sleek. However...i turned it on low and immediately was like WOW thats loud. I cautiously dropped in like two grapes, I got a little juice out of them but the machine got louder and started vibrating a lot. Im like oh okay yeah lets turn it off. I turned it off, then turned back on to try one more little grape. Then, i literally kid you not, the thing vibrated back and forth so hard that it started to “walk”. Incredible...just waddling towards me (and the edge of the counter) like a zombie nightmare! The walking brev! Anyways I got so freaked out I turned it off and immediately packed it into the original packaging to return it. I rarely comment on amazon btw lolol so you know I mean it! Hopefully they wont give me a difficult time via some of the other customers comments I saw.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Rosemarie' to comment on the product 'Waring Pro Professional Meat Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 320.0; Brand: Waring; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Food Grinders & Mills:Meat Grinders'.
output: Regarding the rusting of blades: All of you complaining about the blades rusting have apparently overlooked the obvious - the blades come wrapped in `oily' paper. I SAVED THAT PAPER.Immediately after use I wash the blade, dry it thoroughly and let finish air drying for another half hour or so while cleaning up. Then I rub a thin coating of olive (can use other kind as well) on the blade, wrap it in the original `oily' paper and STORE INSIDE THE PUSHER.It doesn't say so in the instructions, but I'm sure that was the intention of the design of the pusher. The sausage attachment goes in first, then the 3 blades wrapped in the oily paper. I snap the lid back on and everything is there easily accessible. No need to store these blades in a separate bag of rice.So far I've used the grinder 4 times in two months (grinding a boneless leg of lamb, beef roast - along with onion/celery, and pork) all with excellent results and have not had a rusty blade yet.I agree with everything positive said so far. This grinder also looks exceptionally  beautiful, works effortlessly and is easy to assemble and clean up afterwards. I am VERY satisfied with the whole unit - the eye appeal and the performance!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Katie' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Yes, the price sucks, but I love it.: I hear a lot of people talking about how it makes fluffy rice, but personally, I like my jasmine (fragrant) rice on the stickier side. So the trick is to leave it in the cooker on the keep warm setting after it finishes cooking. I do so for at least 2 hours. The texture is amazing. I liked rice before and would have it every week. Now, I have it every day.Important things to know:- It can only make 4 cups (uncooked) jasmine rice. So the 5.5 cup capacity doesn't apply to all types of rice.- The 10 cup version is actually cheaper, so if 4 cups of jasmine rice aren't enough for you, you might want to go for the 10 cup one and save a few bucks at the same time.- It has handles that stay cool, unlike some of the other Zojirushi models.- Has a very handy automatically retractable power cord.Even my boyfriend raved about the rice's texture (and he is not the type to pay attention to that kind of detail). I used to own a cheap rice cooker that cost under 20$. It depends on how picky you are. Sometimes I would hurt my teeth on the uncooked rice of that cheaper machine. The Neuro Fuzzy cooks rice really evenly. None of it sticks to the bottom to form a hard crust.I actually bought a Panasonic Fuzzy Logic rice cooker a few years back (retailing at around 100$) and I returned it to the store, as it couldn't deliver texture-wise.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Rick' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Good upgrade: I had the entry level, plastic bodied Breville that lasted for a few years. This stainless unit is much more robust with a heavy, powerful motor and sturdy metal parts. It blows away my older juicer. It’s well constructed and makes quick work of bulky produce with a larger hopper that allows fewer dumps when you’re going through bags of fruits and vegetables. It doesn’t bog down. Clean up is quick and easy with mild soap and water. The juice container is smallish and will overflow if you’re not paying attention. I’m a frequent juicer and have had many inferior machines in the past that burned up or wore out. I recommend this unit for its hefty construction and indefatigable motor.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Frank Vaughn' to comment on the product 'Waring Pro Professional Meat Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 320.0; Brand: Waring; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Food Grinders & Mills:Meat Grinders'.
output: A conditional 4 star review....: Conditional, as it does the job, but how long will it last?I too grind chicken necks to feed to dogs and while it did grind the 40# I fed it, it certainly did get warm and does not sound very robust.So, it did do the job, but I must wonder how long the motor will last?I have ground 1400 pounds of necks in the largest Cabela's hand grinder over the last several years, and finally decided that my shoulder would take no more. The reviews I read here from the fellow chicken neck grinders led me to this product.One other note: The blade on this grinder is very different from the hand grinder. On the hand grinder, there was more of an angle to the edge, and I found that by sharpening it on a flat stone, it would make the job easier. On this grinder, the blade edges are ~90 degrees, so sharpening does little good.As other reviews stated, this product is certainly NOT "professional" grade. I do think it would be much stronger if not grinding something as tough as chicken necks.Time will tell.09/25/15 Update: Still grinding away. Probable do about 30 lbs. of chicken thighs(w/ bones) a month. I do sharpen the blade on a stone w/ each use. I was surprised this would last this long.

Compared to the other one, it's much better, cooking the rice with less scorching and the coating on the pot isn't as fragile.  It also doesn't spit out the vent hole as much as the older one did.  It did cost over twice as much, but I expect it will last more than twice as long.  Overall, a good cooker I expect to get years of service from.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'RebekB' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Perfect the first time: Washed it, set it up, made a cupful of white rice (sushi style). Result: perfect Asian-restaurant style rice. Wonderful aroma, great texture, and using this cooker is ridiculously easy.  I left the rice on warm - a couple hours later, taste & texture were just as good. The rice doesn't even need seasoning - the long steaming process brings out the flavor in a way that quick cooking never can.I upgraded from a basic Z rice steamer, which made good rice, but was such a mess to clean up after...and could not be used as a warmer for long periods.  While the Neuro Fuzzy is expensive, I figured I would eat a good deal more rice, oatmeal, and steamed Asian-style dishes if I had an easy-to-use cooker. I look forward to experimenting with it...and realistically, a few months of avoiding takeout will pay for it (and will be healthier)!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Tina' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: Loving this juicer: I read all the reviews, taking what i wanted to spend into account, and decided this is the juicer for me. I eagerly awaited it's arrival, and it came even faster then I expected. I took it out and loved it immediately. It's much, much quieter then the one I was using, although it does take a little longer, and i have to cut my fruits and veggies to fit in the hopper. I don't mind this and I should follow my sister-in-laws advice and cut multiple days worth ahead of time. I tried making the banana ice cream, and that just amazed me. I did use a smaller mesh strainer from the suggestions of other reviewers.So far I have mostly juiced with it. I did the banana ice cream and even added raw cocoa powder to make it chocolate ice cream, that was successful. I want to make cookies out of the pulp but I am not that brave yet. I tried making almond butter,and I believe it will work, but I needed to add oil, and I only had olive oil. I didn't like the taste of that and will probably try again with almond oil. I created a juice recipe I actually love... all veggies and 1/2 a pear.... which along with carrots seems to make any combo of veggies taste good to me. I drink about 1 1/2 cups of raw veggie juice a day as part of my therapy to rid myself of cancer. My new oncologist thinks I am doing well, and has encouraged me to keep this going along with a... no sugar, alkaline, vegitarian diet. "Only from the Earth" is his motto. This juicer has become a major part of my path to wellness. I am truly loving this juicer!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'P22nut5' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Zojiroshi NS-RNC 18A  vs  NS-ZCC10 5 1/2 cup: About me: Asian. Cook rice everyday.Price Paid: NS-RNC 18A ( about $50-60, 15 yrs ago ) NS-ZCC10 5 1/2 cup ( $ 185 on Apr 2008 )Constuction: NS-RNC 18A The part that attaches to the inside of rice cooker cover looks cheap. The rice container scratches easier that the NS-ZCC10. NS-ZCC10 Looks well made. One star for that.Durability: NS-RNC 18A Used daily for 15 yrs and was still working properly when replaced. Of course the rice container needs replacing already. But the unit itself was still working like new. NS-ZCC10 Lasted 3 yrs of daily use. Early this year it started not to cook the rice like it used to. It dries up the rice and it makes the top and sides of the cooked rice hard and gummy.Cooking time: NS-RNC 18A: less than 25 minutes NS-ZCC10: 45 minutesCooked White Rice Quality: The same ( I haven't tried cooking brown rice on NS-RNC 18A )Origin: NS-RNC 18A: Made in Thailand NS-ZCC10: Made in JapanAs of today I got my new NS-RNC 18A to replace my NS-ZCC10 which does look nicer but overprice to last only for 3 yrs.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Laura Mappin' to comment on the product 'Proctor Silex Easy Slice Electric Knife for Carving Meats, Poultry, Bread, Crafting Foam and More, Lightweight with Contoured Grip, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 19.61; Brand: Proctor Silex; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Electric Utensils:Electric Knives'.
output: I can't imagine anyone being happy with this knife.: I'm a big guy, and I have big hands, but the handle of this knife is so fat and heavy that I was unable to use it. it is ridiculously fat and disappointingly heavy.I owned a similar knife years ago, and loved it. So I know what I'm talking about. I tried slicing a loaf of fresh (just-baked) French bread and after two slices my hands were exhausted. (One hand holds the knife and the other holds the loaf of bread.)Also: the blades were shorter than my previous one, so they did not even reach all the way through the bread slicing guide.Even worse: after two slices there was a smell of hot plastic/overheating motor, which considerably reduced the pleasure of eating toasted and buttered French bread.Also: the teeth were not sharp. Is this a safety feature? They would not cut through the crust. I set this electric knife aside and used my non-electric serrated bread knife, and it made slices on the same loaf quickly and with ease. So it's not a problem with the bread!!I'm not going to bother returning it: I don't want to waste another moment thinking about this ridiculously poorly designed piece of engineering and throw it straight in the trash.I did give it one star because some people might find it useful on a soft bread like carrot bread or banana bread. But for me the smell was too off-putting.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'penlight' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: steamer zojirushi now better: zojirushi i believe makes the best rice cooker. perfect rice every time. some thoughts...:- i buy the japanese brand of rice from the chinese grocery store for cheap.- if you want steamer and other functions though consider other brands though zojirushi now has one rice cooker/steamer which works pretty well too.- i have never had one break and i have 4 zojirushi's now of different sizes (their breadmaker is sweet too)- consider adding slightly more or less water depending on your climate and how wet/dry you want your rice.- can keep warm for a couple days without trouble- wash the top inner removeable cover regularly otherwise it gets nastyif you eat a ton of rice like my family this is for you. yeah it is pricey but you will never regret it (i suggest getting the zojirushi steamer for additional functions (Zojirushi NL-AAC10 Micom Rice Cooker))

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Pablo Honey' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Carrot juicers, REJOICE!: I am seldom blown away by a product. I'm generally nonplussed, curmudgeonly, and otherwise unexcitable. But I have to say, I am THRILLED with this Breville juicer. We juice five pounds of carrots here every morning, and our previous juicer -- of the masticating variety -- was very slow. It took about 20 minutes to juice the carrots, including the time to re-juice the pulp to get every drop of that orange gold out.But that is not how with works with the Breville, friends. No, you drop the carrots into that beautiful vegetable-crushing vortex -- yes, even the FAT carrots that you had to slice thinner before so they would fit -- and WHOOSH, in two seconds that carrot has been Fargo'd. It's a thing of beauty. So now juicing five pounds of carrots takes maybe five minutes, and you do NOT have to re-juice the remnants because they are already just about powder-dry.So, point-blank, if you want a FAST juicer that gets ALL of the juice out with one pass, this juicer is for you. Absolutely, 100% recommend.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Geumhwa' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Been using for 2 years. Works wonderfully. Love it!!!: First of all, I've been having this rice cooker for 2 years and I don't have any problems with it. :)))I've been feeding on rice as major dish since I could remember, so I'm very picky with the taste and structure of rice. I could tell the difference of good and fresh new rice from others that are not. That's probably why I couldn't make my peace with those simply made Aroma or other american brand cookers. I've tried them all. Yet I just couldn't feel the happiness and satisfaction when I'm using those rice cookers, like the feeling when encountered with delicious food which tastes exactly the same as mom's cooking. So I decided to find an Asian product from China or Japan where people rely on rice as major dish. And I found this on Amazon! Before purchasing, I did some research to make sure. Based on the positive reviews and the fact that Zojirushi is a famous brand in Japan, I figured why not. I'm glad that I did!I've a small family, only me and hubby, so this 5 1/2 cup sized rice cooker fits us perfectly. Normally I set a timer for morning the night before, and the timer indicates when the rice would be ready. It's a very handy function to have for morning cooking. Set it up for 8 am and you'll get rice freshly made ready on 8 am without having to get up 50 minutes earlier to press the cooker on the go. I make bento boxes for my hubby and myself, that's why I really need the timer function.This cooker actually allows you to set 2 timers according to different purposes. It also has different modes as regular, soft, quick cooking, porridge and more. It comes with measuring cups as well. This measuring cups means usual cups as a literal container, not the US measurement method cups. I've seen people getting confused in the review, so I'd like to clarify a little. So if you use the 1 Cup measurement cup to fill rice, it would NOT be the same and in fact, much more than the cooker cup fills. Therefore, stick to the cooker cup for measuring rice would be helpful. What I normally do is to place the cup in the rice container, therefore I've easy access to it and don't need to look for it every time.I've been using this rice cooker on daily base for 2 years and I don't have any problems with it. The only minor thing that I could think of is the monitor not being backlit. Actually I was a little disappointed at first when I knew about it from the reviews, since I thought that'd be a big deal. But as it turns out I wasn't affected by it as much as I expected. So I've made my peace with it. :)))Plus, I've been relocated twice during these years and every time I got relocated, I've packed it up and stored it in a garage for about 3 months. And when I get it out from the package, the monitor time is still running and I've had no problems with the indicator ever. I've seen people complaining about the battery in the review, maybe I haven't encountered with the problem yet since it's only been 2 years. But I think after unplugging for 3 months and still working would mean something.One last thing I wanted to mention is that this rice cooker is easy for cleaning as well. That should be credited to the removable lit.Overall, after 2 years of happy rice time with my rice cooker, I've decided to give it a 5 star review and share my experience with others. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to have a good quality rice cooker and has a small family or just occasionally eat rice. I'm glad with my purchase!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Y. Yasui' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Perfection can now be yours!: Perfect rice everytime.  And you don't even have to be there.  And it'll keep rice perfect and hot for up to 24 hours.  And there are settings for white rice, brown rice, sushi rice and more.We cook family dinner more often because of the Neuro Fuzzy.  I make bento lunches for my son and my family more often with the Neuro Fuzzy.  Any sushi dish must start with perfect rice.  We use Tamaki Gold rice in our neuro fuzzy.It's a small investment for happiness, family meals, picnics, and perfection.UPDATE: 2018Zojirushi Neuro Fuzzy Rice Cooker worked perfectly for 11 years.  This year it just stopped working.  11 years is a long time, but I would have expected more out of a high end, high quality japanese engineered product.  I will update once I contact Zojirushi America Customer Service.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'The Haute Brunette' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Compact Juicer, Silver, BJE200XL, 10" x 10.5" x 16"'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 138.07; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: DANGER DANGER DANGER: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS MACHINE. First, the noise is literally louder than a lawn mower, I’m not being funny or Exaggerating, it hurts my ears to be near it and I’m 31 yes old. When you actually put vegetables and fruit in it the sound gets even crazier, which is even hard to believe since it’s at like a level 11 to begin with. Secondly, it’s is a complete danger to use. The bin can hold an amount of pulp to fill the juice catch but most of the time half way through the machine GETS EVEN LOUDER and flies OFF THE COUNTER. This thing is like 10 pounds of steel (more or less it’s really heavy)!! I bought this for my father that had double knee replacement so that he could juice and help with inflammation. I thank god that I used this for him the first time to show him because if he had used it himself he wouldn’t have been fast enough to press the emergency off button. He seriously may have never been able to walk again or worse. The thought of it makes me sick. I only bought this model because of the color, as we have little storage space and it sits on the counter permanently and wanted to look nice and for the amount of money it cost, it is the scariest thing to use. I have been meaning to post this for a while, but I still have it and use it because I can’t return it and it costs so much. I need to create a barrier with my coffee machine so it doesn’t fly off the counter and kill my dog. I would have returned it but I threw away the box and and used it before I realized it is a death trap.

He may like the rice better from this machine, but I'm cooking it and I'm fed up.

output: ... instructions manual is a bit overly complicated but I love this rice cooker: The instructions manual is a bit overly complicated but I love this rice cooker. One of my favorite features is you can set the rice for a "to be finished by" time and leave. If you want to eat dinner at 6:00 but won't be home until 5:45 you can set it in the morning before you leave and at 5:00 (depending on how cooked you want the rice) the rice cooker will automatically start and be ready for you. It's a really nice addition to standard rice cookers. Also, in terms of design, the handle and the retractable cord are both great additions to most rice cookers.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Joseph Brancatelli' to comment on the product 'BLACK+DECKER G48TD Waffle Maker, 3-in-1, Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 69.99; Brand: BLACK+DECKER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: The high cost of nostalgia: I had a Toastmaster waffle maker with a reversible plate for pizzella. It lasted perhaps 30 years and died. This one, with the Black and Decker name subbing for Toastmaster LOOKS the same although it has a flattop on the reverse side of the waffle plate.Don't be deceived. It's garbage. instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Ms. T. Hill' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: At first: At first I regretted my decision because it was between this juicer and the so popular Breville. However, after a couple of uses with various fruits and produce, I was happy. Other reviews I read comment on how slow the machine is...well that's because it's taken it's time to get all of the juice out. The easy cleanup makes up for the speed, which is not that slow. Another thing I realize is that the juicer is very portable, and it can go on road trips. The last convincing test was when I juiced berries in a fast juicer and it strewed the berries everywhere-inside the cutting basket and on the inside container. I juiced the same type of berries in the Omega and the pulp came out dry and the cleanup was SO easy. I do not regret my decision at all. This juicer is efficient, portable, and respects fruits and veggies. Stop living life in the fast lane, slow down to reap all of its benefits...one will receive two rewards great juice and eatable pulp.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Nancy' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Love this rice cooker: I've had this rice cooker for three years, using it every other day and haven't had a problem with it. I use it to mainly cook brown rice of various kinds (which takes around 1 hour and 50 min to cook brown rice)  and I have cooked white rice with it (takes around 50 min ) and both come out perfectly. Couldn't care less if the battery wears out (it hasn't so far) as I never use the timer feature.  Very easy to use and clean. The bowl is non-stick and the inner lid is removable for cleaning. You need to use the little cup it comes with to measure your rice and the cup holds 150 ml or close to 2/3 of a cup. Once it is finished cooking, it switches to a warm mode and shows the time it is in warm mode by the hour. This cooker is  far superior to cooking rice on the stove, oven or using the cheap rice cooker I use to have. I would highly recommend it. Update six years after buying it , the battery died, but I just plug it into an outlet, reset the clock and menu and it's good to go. My non-stick pan looks brand new. I just clean it with a nylon scrubbie and I store the cooked rice in another pan. I suppose it is just habit from when I cooked rice on the stove top. Still happy with my purchase.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Suzanne' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Love it!: To get the boring stuff out of the way, the shipping was very quick and it was well packaged.I've never had a rice cooker before, I've always cooked on the stove with irritatingly inconsistent results ranging from nearly inedible to fantastic. instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Darryle T.' to comment on the product 'Presto 07211 Liddle Griddle'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 40.86; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Griddles'.
output: Checked Plate Temperature;s: I checked the plate temperature on this griddle only because i wanted to see where 225 degree setting was on the dial. I was very surprised to find that temperatures varied so much on different spots on the plate. I was more surprised to find that the markings on the temperature dial were so far off, they might as well not have been there. I think that with some trial and error this will be a good little griddle i hope.Checking temperatures with an inferred thermometer, i found that the coolest spot was right where the control plugged into the unit. The hottest spot was the furthest point right above the point where you plug in the control. When i first rotate the dial with a cold plate the light comes on about half way between off and warm. After about 1 minute i checked the temperatures and they ran around 215 to 255 at different spots. With the dial set to 200 i was in the 305 to 376 range. With the dial set to 400 i was shocked to see the temperature readings i was getting. They ran from 465 to 612.  The 612 reading was the hot spot described above and the temperature light had just turned off . With your hand 12 to 15 inches held above this unit, you can feel this thing cranking out the heat. I don't see me ever cooking anything above the warm setting.People need to always be careful with any item that heats up for cooking and not leave them unattended. Think safety always.Maybe i have a bad control unit? I will give cooking a shot on this then decide if i keep it or toss it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'S. Dee' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Helpful Little Cooker!: I purchased this unit and after reading the other reviews, I was a little ambivalent as to how useful it would be. I decided to give a try for myself. It is great help to be able to cook rice/pasta and not have to worry about the food burning because it was left the stove on too long. However, there a couple of things that detract from its usefulness. If you are cooking something with just one or one and a half cups of liquid, then it is not a problem. When you cook more than that amount, the liquid will boil over. When I cook something that requires more liquid (such as risotto) I  leave the lid off and that way, it does not boil over. It does sort of defeat the purpose of "steaming" rice rather than "boiling" rice, but it is a lot less messy. Secondly, the pot insert which is supposed to be non-stick surface is very thinly coated and mine has already been scratched on the bottom. The thought that I have ingested that coating with my food does not make for a very appetizing nor healthy meal! The steam insert is great to have, as you can put the veggies into the steamer and put that on top of the cook pot while the rice is cooking. My suggestion to the manufacturer would be to redesign the steamer insert so that there is not a groove at the bottom which can trap food and bacteria and which is difficult to clean. Also, they should make the cook pot coating more durable so that it does not peel off with normal use. Apart from these two issues, I find that having a rice cooker/steamer is a very convenient item to have and the size of this particular cooker does not take up too much counter space and it pleasing to look at.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Cecilia Adams' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: THE BEST RICE MAKER: I have wanted one for almost a decade now, and repeatedly convinced myself my old 20$ rice cooker was fine, no need to upgrade. SO WRONG. I have never had such amazing rice, it’s literally so easy. Measure the rice with the included scoops, rinse and drain the rice in the pot with water and your hands 3x , then add the water to the corresponding marked liquid line on the container. Press start and you’re cooking! Once it’s done, I use the handy rice spatula that has its own hook on the machine (never lost it yet!) and fluff. Your rice will stay warm all day. It’s so beautiful I want to cry. Seriously, treat yourself..it’s incredible! BTW, it truly is nonstick. The previously one I owned claimed to be nonstick, it was always burning the bottom and leaving a lot of residue.Thins one NEVER does.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Angie' to comment on the product 'Aroma Housewares ASP-137 Grillet 3Qt. 3-in-1 Cool-Touch Electric Indoor Grill Portable, Dishwasher Safe, 3-Quart, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 31.1; Brand: Aroma Housewares; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Grills'.
output: Love this product, but durability is questionable!: Hoover FloorMate is the only floor cleaner that works for my hard wood floor house.  I have used floormate since 2002 (it's now 2019).  Since then, on the average of 1.5 to 2 years, the machine stops working!  I switched to Bissell Crosswave All-in-One wet-dry cleaner thinking it will last longer because it is almost double the price.  Bissell lasts just over 1 year as well.  Bissell's suction is even less powerful.  I will never buy a BISSELL floor cleaner again.Since I am tired of Hoover floor mate durability, so I went back to mopping.  After a year on manual mopping, the floor is never as clean.  So I decided to get back to Hoover Floor Mate thinking Hoover has improved its durability in the last 3 years?  I hope this machine will last at least another 2 years or MORE!!!Hoover, please copy Dyson's philosophy and build a durable machine.  You are the best in hardwood floor cleaning machine, but you have a HUGE issue in the product durability!
