instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Patrick' to comment on the product 'Presto 03430 Pizzazz Plus Rotating Oven, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 79.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Ovens & Toasters:Countertop Pizza Ovens'.
output: Must have.: If you are a Pizza lover or have children, then this is a must have. I have owned one for at least the last 12-15 years. I have 4 sons who absolutely love pizza and use this all the time to reheat their Pizza. 3 of my sons have moved out and this is the first appliance that I buy for them and they love it. I actually use it on fresh bought  pizza to make it crispy. I grew up in NY, worked in Manhattan and had pizza all the time. I like to be able to fold my pizza and have it stand up by itself, however that is rarely found in Florida. Whenever I order pizza I ask to have it done crispy but it is still a little weak. So as soon as I bring the Pizza home, I immediately put it on the Pizzazz and set it to the lower setting and it makes the crust crispy, just the way I like it and it works perfectly. The Pizzazz has 3 settings on it, upper lower and both. This way if you want you can heat up just the bottom or top.The second thing that I love about the Pizzazz is the fact that it has a timer. You can set the type of heat you want top, bottom or both and then set the timer. This works great with kids  (especially teenagers), where they place a piece of pizza on it and walk away. Then return hours later to eat it. My sons used to turn the oven on, put the pizza in and forget about. Now the pizza is burnt and the oven has been on for hours. Basically it will save you money in electricity and pay for itself, and possibly save your house from burning down. Also if you live in Florida like me, the last thing you want to do in the summer is turn the oven on because it heats up the whole house, especially if its on for hours.The last thing is you don't have to use it for just cooking pizza. I use it to heat up plenty of other foods. Like a left over chicken parm sandwich (it makes the bread nice and crispy), tatter tots,  or even make garlic bread. To make garlic bread, cut some Italian bread in half, put some butter on it and sprinkle some garlic powder. Place it on the Pizzazz set the timer and your done.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Richard S.' to comment on the product 'Presto 02970 Professional SaladShooter Electric Slicer/Shredder, Black,1 count'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 73.49; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Electric Utensils:Electric Slicers'.
output: Works great for things intended to be used in it: I have both sizes of the salad shooter.  We got one 35 years ago as a gift and it finally gave out this year because one of the cones cracked.  I have picked up a half dozen of them in the thrift shops through the years. I have one in the motor home and given some to the adult children.  I have had no problem with solid things.  It is not designed for onions.  a hand chopper or small food processor is great for onions. I do it all with a sharp knife in seconds.  Very soft cheese would never work even on a hand grater.  If you can't grate it on a hand grater the machine will not do it.  Onions are slime and they will not work.  I use it for shredding cheese, potato's all the time.  I can shop carrots so fast that it does not pay to get out the shooter.  If you want fancy cuts it is great.  I can use knives very well and keep them razor sharp.  I would never be without one.  I use it several times a week.  It is one of the few kitchen gadgets that I would not be without.  I read all the bad reviews.  They were a hoot.  Not so bright club.  They don't melt in the dishwasher unless you let them slip to the bottom and touch the heating element.  After 35 years of being cleaned in the dish washer I have never had any kind of problem.  For all the things people can't get it to do learn to use a knife but I am not sure you will be safe.  LOL

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Dana Phelps' to comment on the product 'Proctor Silex Durable Electric Vegetable Chopper & Mini Food Processor for Chopping, Puree & Emulsify, 1.5 Cup, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 14.99; Brand: Proctor Silex; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Food Processors'.
output: Not the Greatest: It has a design flaw that when you try to make it work, the activator is part of the top of the container with the blade. If you don't set that just perfectly with the food in the container, it won't work. When you do it just right, still sometimes it's next to impossible to get to function. It's also pretty cheap material. I wouldn't even recommend this for a cheap functional food processor. instruction: Please simulate consumer 'calico' to comment on the product 'Presto 05450 DualDaddy Electric Deep Fryer, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 44.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Fryers:Deep Fryers'.
output: Twice as Big!: For years, I have always had a Fry Baby, Fry Daddy, etc. and liked the idea of having two separate sides for different foods. instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Cinda ' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart WMR-CAP2 Round Classic Waffle Maker, Brushed Stainless,Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 29.95; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: Perfect size and perfect waffles!: The temperature control is perfect right in the middle, and you do get golden brown when the light turns green! It will depend on what you have in your batter or if you put some thing on the griddle surface, but I don’t put anything but a little brushing of oil. I heard nonstick spray isn’t really good for you so I don’t use it. The surface has been nonstick even when I have forgotten to use a little brush of oil. I don’t think you have to keep reapplying it for every waffle. I really love mine and I think you will enjoy it too, at such a really good price. As a added TIP, use on your stove top with the hood-fan running on low because it does cook quickly and it will send up a little bit of smoke sometimes.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Michele' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Amazing appliance!: We absolutely LOVE our Breville Juice Fountain!  We use it every day - sometimes, twice daily.  We have juiced many fruits and veggies, but we especially like juicing pear, apple, carrot, celery and pineapple.  Sometimes, I substitute the pineapple with orange.  It takes minutes to prepare a healthy and vitamin packed beverage and I love that I have total control over what I am consuming.  I would not ordinarily eat celery and do not much care for pears, but it's amazing how wonderful those things taste when they are juiced.  I was amazed at how sweet and refreshing a beverage I can get from juicing.  I have used the pulp to thicken vegetable soup and also I removed the pulp before juicing anything else and added that to my carrot muffins - delicious!We have found the 'trick' is to clean the machine immediately after use - and it takes less than five minutes to do so.  We don't bother lining the pump container either.  We hand wash all the components and let air dry.  The machine lives up to its reputation and was well worth the investment.

I will pay more for it if I have to, this product is that good.- It's surprisingly dangerous so make sure you follow directions. Boiling hot kernels can go flying if you're not careful. Please come out with a BPA free version!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'EDSZIPPERHEAD' to comment on the product 'Presto 04830 PowerPop Microwave Multi-Popper, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 24.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Popcorn Poppers'.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'C. Barry' to comment on the product 'Waring Pro Professional Meat Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 320.0; Brand: Waring; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Food Grinders & Mills:Meat Grinders'.
output: Definitely Recommend !: I love to cook and have practically every appliance available. Many items remain in their boxes and are seldom used, but this grinder is an exception. The idea of buying store-bought ground meats is a real turn off since I have been grinding my own. Most of us have seen or read about what goes in the meat we buy or question the hygiene of the store employees or handlers of the product. That being said, the Waring Pro lives up to all of its positive reviews.Cleanup is easy, especially if it is done right away so parts don't have meat drying and sticking. I air dry and store the grinding plates in a bag of rice as another reviewer suggested, preventing the need to oil and avoiding the guminess that can be caused with prolonged storage.The noise of the motor that some felt was excessive is to me what would be expected from a grinder, it can't do the job and purr like a kitten!The unit is well made, sturdy, attractive, and gets the job done with ease. No problems with jams or speed and the finished product is a beautiful thing! I also suggest running bread or crackers through to purge the remains from the meat.Ground beef is my primary use for this machine and after extensive Internet searches for the best cuts to use, I have found that a combination of chuck and sirloin renders the best flavor, texture, and fat content. I trim any silver skin and grizzle from the meat, cube and chill, and run it first through the course grind, then the medium. When sirloin steaks are on sale (typically $2.98 lb. at the local Wegmans) I will ask the butcher for the whole cryovaced piece and purchase an equal amount of chuck at around $2.49 lb. This makes the price of top quality, safe and delicious ground beef comparable to the regular priced store-bought. I have found that the texture tends to be softer when using whole cuts rather than trimings so resist the temptation to grind more than twice.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'JB Blanchard' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Marginal design equals marginal performance: It cooks the rice.  Otherwise, I'm not so happy.1)  It tends to boil over (adding oil or butter helps -- but so would good design).2)  It scorches when I use stock instead of water.3)  You have to be there to unplug it, there's no auto-shutoff, although it will go into permanent warming mode.4)  You have to load it before plugging it in, otherwise it goes right into warming mode.5)  The cooking directions are wrong (what? it's a rice cooker) -- use the directions on the rice, not in the book.6)  The lid doesn't fit.  Not on the pot, and not on the steamer.7)  The "cool" extra steamer gadget overcooks everything -- other than riceSo go with the Zojirushi systems -- they're made by pros.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Em' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NHS-06 3-Cup (Uncooked) Rice Cooker, White (-WB)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 51.82; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Nifty, speedy little rice cooker great for one person: I got the 3 cup model. This rice cooker is very easy to use and wash, and cooks quickly. I timed it, and 1 cup of rice (using their measuring cup) cooked in just 19.5 minutes. I'm a very spontaneous meal-maker, so not having to wait for my rice to finish cooking every time I made a stir fry has been really nice. 20 minutes is just enough time to start making rice, then prep ingredients and cook for faster recipes, or to start making rice as soon as I start cooking for others.However, the first time I used it, it spewed rice water everywhere. I had to put a kitchen towel on top of it to prevent it from making a huge mess. After reading the reviews, I realized I needed to wash the rice a lot better. My old rice cooker was way more lenient about this, but here you need to wash and drain the rice 4-5 times until the water runs almost clear-- see picture attached. That solved my rice water spraying problems entirely!It's also pretty small, which is great for saving on counter space. Only negative is that there's no holder for the rice spatula, so I just keep that in my drawers.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'someday2005' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart WMR-CAP2 Round Classic Waffle Maker, Brushed Stainless,Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 29.95; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: The Perfect Waffle Maker For Me: I love this classic waffle maker, I had been looking for a waffle maker that makes thin waffles (This is not a Belgian Waffle maker). Not everyone likes a thin waffle, but these waffles are the perfect size for me. The size reminds me of the Waffle House waffles that I love, but it was time for me to begin making my own.This waffle maker gets really hot, and the waffles turn out nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I like my batter to be the consistency of cake batter (not thick). I pour my batter using a 6 oz styrofoam cup.  I did use pancake mix for these waffles, just follow the instructions for making waffles. I added 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract and 1.5 tbsp of nonfat dry buttermilk to the mix. The waffles were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I did use a little heavy cream to get a soft inside texture.  If you like to make and freeze waffles, I suggest you use a low setting so that your waffles don't get too dark. If the waffles are too dark and you place them in the toaster after freezing, they will darken even more and burn. I know some reviewers have mentioned the dial being too loose. It does feel loose, but it works, for now, anyway. If there are any changes, I will update my review. I suggest that you clean your waffle maker with a damp dish towel before using for the first time.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'david' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: I don't know if there is a better pot out there but I would keep looking for $50...: It's just ok.  the cord is very short and you'll need to use an extension cord if you want to use it at a table.  The main problem is the uneven heat - it is all on or all off.  It has a dial but it only varies how long the heat is on not the temperature.  Cheese burns to the bottom unless every time the heat is on you stir wildly until it clicks off.  I wouldn't even try chocolate in it.  I am thinking about trying it as a double boiler for chocolate - water in the pot and another bowl with chocolate above it. Disappointing for the price.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'FasterThanLight' to comment on the product 'Proctor Silex Easy Slice Electric Knife for Carving Meats, Poultry, Bread, Crafting Foam and More, Lightweight with Contoured Grip, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 19.61; Brand: Proctor Silex; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Electric Utensils:Electric Knives'.
output: A stick of butter is sharper: I was dumbfounded by how underpowered this knife is-  it pulls down cutting regular _bread_.  Furthermore, the blade is so short you have to be right up against the bread so it will cut it- very uncomfortable.  Blades dull- not sharp at all, requires force to get it through regular bread.  I had an old Black & Decker- wish I'd kept it.Several weeks later, I finally threw this in the trash and am looking at different brands.  So dull I couldn't even cut a fresh loaf of bread with it-- a regular knife is sharper and faster.... I hate this thing.  So dull, I swear a stick of butter is sharper-  and this is only after about 8 uses!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'J/R Tahoe' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart 4 Slice Toaster Oven, Brushed Stainless, CPT-180P1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 53.59; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Ovens & Toasters:Toasters'.
output: Sliced bread doesn't fit & a slider on both sides bent and get stuck at the bottom: A normal slice of bread needs to be bent or flexed to fit in the slot. If I toss it in, depressing the lever leaves the bread hanging with the risen top sticking out. I need to push it down, but can only do it when the toasting elements are already heating, and I am using store bought oatnut bread.I was actually willing to deal with that, but in less than 8 months of light use, one slider started passing out of the slide track at the bottom and getting stuck, so it wouldn't pop up when toasting was complete. I was able to yank up on it for a while, but eventually that stopped working so I disassembled it to see if it could be bent back into shape. It worked a few times, then continued getting stuck. Sometimes the heating element would stay engaged and start to burn the item.I gave up on that side and we were fine but now the other side started doing it to, so I am shopping again. I can't believe the price of this given the quality. I hate throwing cheap stuff in the landfill, so I shoot for durable items in a slightly higher price range so it can at least be repaired if it breaks.I can attest to the crumb tray not working as well. We have it on an external tray and still need to sweep loads of crumbs away.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Christina Rose' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Coveted for YEARS, now I own one!: I have a really hard time forking out a lot of money for appliances. I know that you get what you pay for, but that spend-thrift inside of me just really stands aghast. I had experienced the rice from this machine at a friend's house, about 5 years a go, and was instantly jealous of this cooker, but of course, I had to wait until I could get a better deal. People: you will not be disappointed or regret a single dollar that you throw at this machine.1) It is easy, almost fool proof. Measure the rice, rinse, fill water to the appropriate line, put the pot in, close the lid, find your setting,  hit "cook."2) Rice cooks perfectly all by itself, adjusting within the cooker for the perfect time and texture. The neuro fuzzy plays a little tune when done, but worried you'll miss it?3) Don't be worried! The cooker automatically changes to "Keep Warm" mode. If you forget about your rice, it will be soft, fluffy and delicious for you, for up to 12 hours!3.5) Fluffy and delicious? Oh boy, yes. Seriously, tastes like the wonderful rice you get at any take-out restaurant. I used Calrose rice and it made fluffy, separate grains that also would stick together if pressed. I can't wait to experiment with Jasmine and Brown rices.4) If you're like me, if clean-up is a hassle, you'll think twice before using an appliance again. I lifted out the pot, filled with hot water, swished it around, and wiped it out with a paper towel. That was it. No more mess, no harsh chemicals needed, no effort. Clean as a whistle.I am in LOVE.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'V in AZ' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Easy to use, and makes yummy rice.: I was debating getting another $20 rice cooker but we do a lot of rice at home. I'm glad I chose this. It takes the guess work out of all kinds of rice. We can eat brown jasmine, basmati, sticky, and about anything else you can imagine.When it arrived I was a tad overwhelmed by all the buttons and manual is a little hard to read. It took a little time and it's actually super easy to use. I'd say the directions are the hardest part! You have a little white scoop, you fill it with rice, fill the removable bowl with water/broth and adjust the cooker to the type of rice you are making. It sings a little song and makes the rice. Caveat- it can take a LONG time. Brown rice, especially. And, since it's using all that fuzzy logic stuff it has no idea when it's going to finish. I have gotten good at estimating and you will have to as well. I've gotten bold and I add broths, and savory herbs, onions, garlic, and other goodies to make pilafs. The Zojirushi manages to turn out a delicious pot of rice no matter what I put in there.Super super super easy to clean!The feature that allows you to put it all in in advance is excellent as well.Love it. Use it several times a week since we bought it almost a year ago. Worth every penny.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Allison' to comment on the product 'Presto 04821 Orville Redenbacher's Hot Air Popper, 1 Liters, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 39.61; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Popcorn Poppers'.
output: Fast, Healthy, Cheap, and Yummy Snacking: A small bag of popcorn kernels costs less than buying bags of pre-popped popcorn, and the kernel bag gives you so much more popcorn than the pre-popped alternative.  I have tried several systems for popping corn at home, and some systems waste kernels by burning them, such as some microwave versions.  With the Orville Redenbacher's Hot Air Popper, I have never had a burnt kernel.  The lid at the top is for measuring out the kernels (including telling you the max amount), but it can also be used to warm the butter (I don't use butter or toppings).  The machine turns the kernels into popcorn very quickly, in a manner that is entertaining to the kids (...and I find it fun too).  The popcorn can be enjoyed warm, directly after making, or put it in some zip-lock bags for later use at room temperature.  The kids, my husband, and I all find this to be an enjoyable, healthy, and super-fast-to-prepare snack.  Our machine seems sturdy and well made.  Hope you enjoy this machine as much as we have been!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Mickey Fan' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'I love to read' to comment on the product 'Presto 04821 Orville Redenbacher's Hot Air Popper, 1 Liters, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 39.61; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Popcorn Poppers'.
output: No ON/OFF switch: Honestly at this point that's my biggest issue. I bought 2, one for me and one as a gift for my niece (she has 4 kids, the youngest is 5, the oldest is 13). I just got mine today, got it already, plugged it in and it sparked at me.If it has no ON/OFF switch it is basically always on and I worry the sparking issue could become a safety issue with her kids. I bought it so that my niece's kids could make themselves an inexpensive snack while letting their overworked mom rest.An ON/OFF switch is vital to them and that end.When she receives her popcorn popper I will ask her what she thinks and hers will probably be returned for one that may not pop as well (and this one does) but is safer for my niece's kids.Otherwise this is a good machine.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Matt Carroll' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Love the juicer: Love the juicer.  Like other reviewers, I also got this a few years ago after watching Fat, Sick and Nearly Dead.  (A must-see along with Sugar: The Bitter Truth)I don't think cleanup could get much better.  The included brush makes cleaning the blades (usually the most difficult part of cleanup) very simple.  The bag in the pulp container is an OK trick, but even better is to compost the pulp - no bag needed!  After juicing, dump a quart of water in with the pulp, swish around, then rinse the pulp into your compost bin.  Easy!I usually put an ice-cube or two in the juice container to cool things down ASAP.  (Not enough to noticeably water down the juice though!)

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'George B. Parrott' to comment on the product 'BLACK+DECKER G48TD Waffle Maker, 3-in-1, Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 69.99; Brand: BLACK+DECKER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: Poor fit and finish, uneven heat: As others have noted, the fit is very poor.  In my unit the clip that holds the lower plate in place will not stay closed.  There is a significant gap around the edges of the lower plate, you can see the heating element.  As a result it takes a long time to heat and a long time to cook.You'll need hot pads to hold the lower plate down while opening the waffle iron.Thankfully the upper plate stays clipped into place, although it also moves quite a bit.The instructions advise 3-5 minutes to bake a waffle, I found 8-9 minutes were required.  Not so good if you are tying to make a bunch of waffles for a group.The plates are very light and don't retain much heat, so the heating element is on most of the time.  The center of the waffle gets quite dark by the time the edges are cooked, even if the waffle doesn't completely fill the plate.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'WesternWilson' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output:
New or old to juicing, this is the one!!: We bought this juicer over a year ago, fired up by watching "Fat, Sick, and Nearly Dead" (which applied to us!). We have been juicing with it 4-5 times a week ever since, and recently had a chance to spend a weekend with a friend who bought the Omega juicer instead, lured by the promise of better extraction and dryer pulp.

I am here to tell you the Breville wins hands down. The Omegas are fine machines, but you must cut everything up in teensy pieces, it takes forever (forever!) to process the bits, and some things get stuck easily ie. kale or celery when not perfectly crisp. The Omega process takes forever.

The Breville is super fast...first because the wide feed chute means you can feed in whole carrots, zucchini and cukes, and it tears through ginger root, halved apples, oranges, beets, and bunches of greens. Most mornings I get up and quickly do the day's 2 L (2 quarts) of juice for the family (two of us often have juice for lunch or mid-day snacks as well) in LESS THAN 15 MINUTES!!!! And that includes cleanup.

The machine is going strong after a year of really tough use and dishwashering of all the parts you need to clean. I like the large juice reservoir (about 3 1/2 c) but wish it were larger. An optional 2 L. reservoir would be nice for power juicers.

We find starting the day with a big iced glass of fruit/veggie juice has helped us in so many ways....we feel better, we've been able to lose weight, we feel more mental and physical energy. The easy to use Breville has helped us keep with the program. Highly recommended for new juicers, and will be a welcome experience to those who have been hampered by the slow, dreary chore of feeding a mastication style juicer. Give it a try.

No more than 20 words. Product price: 14.99; Brand: Proctor Silex; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Food Processors'.
output: SKIP THE OTHER MANUFACTURERS AND BUY THIS ONE FOR A DOLLAR OR TWO MORE: For years, I bought a brand name product that is very similar to this Proctor Silex chopper/dicer at the Dollar General store.  Amazon has the same product available here for a $1 or $2 less.  I went through at least 3 of the other brand slicer/dicers in about the same number of years (they even "improved" their design).  I also had to return one because it did not work at all (something which raised eyebrows and resulted in me getting some dirty looks - but I figure even if it was just $15, the thing ought to work when you take it out of the box).  SO SKIP THAT BRAND!  This Proctor Silex is wonderful!  It is much easier to align the container, blade, and top -- it is so easy that even when I am not awake, I can't screw up the alignment).  The other GREAT thing about the Proctor Silex is that it only chops once everything is together - you press down on the top - and voila.  The blade is sharper than the other brand and instead of winding up with onion juice or celery juice, I get something much closer to grated onion, celery, carrot, cheese.  I even used it on chopped liver (cooked) and turkey giblets.  Worked beautifully.  I own a 4-cup Proctor Silex drip coffee maker from the early 90s I bought second hand at a thrift store for $2 some 12 years ago.  I figured it would last for a few months, so we bought back-up 4-cup drip coffee makers just in case.  It might not be the most attractive appliance in my kitchen, and you do have to clean it every so often with a little vinegar and hot water, but that Proctor Silex coffee maker has outlasted every other coffee maker I have ever owned.  Now, mind you - I cannot promise but I have a strong feeling that for the extra $2 for this Proctor Silex chopper/grater, you are getting the same quality!  I rate this five thumbs up.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Doug in LA' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: works great for certain fruits and vegetables: I've used this product for a couple of months now.  For most vegetables, it works fine.  However, some fruits and vegetables, cause the machine's screens become clogged and the juice then really backs-up.  For instance, the machine has problems with tomatoes, certain apples and strawberries.  It seems that any fruit or vegetable that is the slightest bit mushy with, an above-average juice content, will cause a backup.  While the backup will usually clear (if you do not add new produce for a few minutes), the machine probably needs  more high-pressure and low-pressure screened area--the screens allow extracted juice to flow out of the machine and in to your collection container.  This machine excels at extracting juice from crisp apples, carrots, beets, celery and leafy green vegetables.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'laurie' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Champs R Us' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Very pleased so far.: I received this rice cooker today.  I was torn with the size. Can I feed my family, and have leftovers with this? We are a family of five and was torn between the ten cup and the 5.5.  After I ordered the 5.5 I really felt like I should have ordered the 10 cup, even though I am not crazy about adding more appliances to my limited counter space. Most reviews don't mention how much this cooker will feed.  Well, for my family, we all ate to our hearts content and still had plenty of leftovers.  Given that my kids are all eight and under, we don't need a larger cooker. It was quite a bit of rice that it makes! I can probably feed 7 people easily with this cooker. If you entertain a lot, or eat a lot (hello carbs) I'd go the next size up, not a big price difference. It produced excellent Sushi rice, not burned at all on the bottom, a first for me! I have gone from a fancy $$$ Breville, to an Oster and they all burned on the bottom. This came out perfect from the first try. I recommend this rice cooker, didn't give it a five, because I have not had it long enough to give it a perfect rating. Best appliance I have bought in years. Also, would like to add that it plays a cute tune when it starts the cook cycle. It is a unique appliance.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Laura' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: Not a bad juicer but....not that great either: Well, let's start with the pros.1. It makes good juice.2. It cleans up easily3. It is very quiet.The above reasons are why I bought this machine. However, it turns out that these things are not enough for me.The cons:1. EVERYTHING must be chopped before inserting into the ridiculously tiny feed chute.  This didn't sound so bad, all the other reviewers were doing it happily.  Well, I'm here to tell you that it turns making juice into a chore that you will often find you don't want to do.2. One of my motivations for buying this juicer is that I juice a lot of greens, especially lettuce and kale and chard. Supposedly a masticating juicer does this better and gets more juice out than a centrifugal. This has not been my experience. AND you will find that making a head of romaine lettuce into 1.5" strips and then stuffing them into a little chute is not fun and takes forever. Lettuce bits go everywhere.  And then they get stuck and you have to turn the reverse on or sometimes take it apart to get the clog out. This is because you have to mash them into the chute to get them through.  Sure carrot sticks go through just fine, as do apples and celery but I want more out of my juice than just carrots.3. The juice comes out below the feed chute and the pulp spits out the end of the auger.  This means you need to place two small plastic bowls right next to each other to catch them.  The pulp builds up on the edge of the juice bowl and unless you push it out of the way constantly it falls into the juice.  Plus the bowls are not very big so they fill up quickly if you are making juice for more than one person and you have to stop and empty them while juice drips everywhere. Sure you can put another cup under while you do this to catch the drips but now I have to wash another cup. A small problem but still, I'm a busy person.4. As another reviewer noted, soft fruits don't go through well. Strawberries and pineapples need a lot of coddling.I'm sure some of you who love this juicer are thinking, oh she's a newbie and doesn't understand juicing. This is not so, I have been juicing happily for years with first a cheap Braun and later a more pricey Breville Juice Fountain Elite. I loved my Breville. It made juicing fun and rewarding. After my ex made off with it I figured it was time to get a serious juicer. A masticating juicer. But I'm afraid that it just sucked the fun out of juicing.  I dread the chopping and stuffing and clogging etc.  The worst part is that I spent my juicer budget on this monster and now don't have the cash to buy another Breville which is what I should have done in the first place.So it's a good thing I have a vita-mix and can just go back to making green smoothies all the time instead.  I like to go back and forth between juicing and smoothies because I think they are both good for you.Bottom line, if you are new to juicing, just get a centrifugal and learn from there. Then later, if you want to become a health martyr who suffers for their low-oxidation juice then help yourself to it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Dee' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Cuisinart Electric Fondue Pot & Accessories: Ok, so what is there not to like other than the fact that I dont have two of these.  My husband and I went to the Melting Pot for dinner for our anniversary.  Now I have never been to a fondue restaurant so I did not know what to expect.  Needless to say,  I was thoroughly impressed and so in love by the time that we left that I just had to have a fondue pot of my own.  After searching high and low for a fondue pot, I found exactly what I was looking for here on Amazon.  I ordered the fondue pot and it arrived to my house in about 3-5 days.  When it got here I was already prepared with chocolate, crunchy peanut butter, strawberries and marshmallows.  The directions for use are so easy and the recipes are easy too.  My family and I (children included) had a blast dipping our goodies into our chocolate and peanut butter concoction and it was wonderful.  If anyone is in the market for a fondue pot, this is the one.  I guarantee you that you will want to add a second or even a third one so that you can use each for a different item such as cheese, a meat/vegetable broth and one for desssert.  You will not be dissapointed.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'CynWillTravel' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. output: The Best of Health ! NO MORE FIBROMYALGIA: I was reading reviews for months by the different types of juicers.  I have blenders but I needed a juicer for the celery juice craze ....well, my only regret is that I didn't buy it sooner. This Breville elite is substantial - steel - well weighted bottom- secure cord and easy to clean - I mean very easy and comes with a scrubbing brush - all done within 3 minutes and I'm off. If you're not if you want a slow mulching juicer - omg I would have lost my mind and patience with those - I need something fast and efficient !! I have been juicing celery now for 6 weeks - I wanted better digestion and better skin- I was not prepared for the ELIMINATION OF FIBROMYALGIA !!! That is correct - I have no body pains - It is a joke how much money I have spent on acupuncture and pills and anything that would help me with body pains for 8 EIGHT years!!  Who knew celery juice would be the cure  ? Seriously!! Get the Medical Medium's book - the original one and all the others too. I will be juicing celery for the rest of my life !! So get this juicer and get rid of inflammation in your body. I'll see you at the gym !! Cheers!!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'MN_Jack76' to comment on the product 'Presto 03430 Pizzazz Plus Rotating Oven, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 79.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Ovens & Toasters:Countertop Pizza Ovens'.
output: It has no ON/OFF switch!: You can't make this up! It requires you to unplug the unit or the fan and rotating motor will run continuously. This does not work for me as I bought it for the "Man Cave" and the outlet is behind a large gun safe. The unit draws over ten amps so the only switches I had around the house that could handle this was a on/off standard wall switch. 2nd, the cooking plate never sits fully flat and locks in. Picture a plate being supported by a nail. It tilts on all axes depending on whether the weight is centered. And I am not talking a little.. It's looser than my cheating ex. Sadly Presto is now another company that used to make quality but has gone Chinese cheap. I kid you not, in the manual they explain the cord is so short to "prevent a tripping hazard"!?!

The plastic part that attaches to the body and holds the different slicing discs has fallen several times on the tile floor over the years and the pusher dozens of times without any damage. instruction: Please simulate consumer 'MikeinNC' to comment on the product 'Aroma Housewares ASP-137 Grillet 3Qt. 3-in-1 Cool-Touch Electric Indoor Grill Portable, Dishwasher Safe, 3-Quart, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 31.1; Brand: Aroma Housewares; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Grills'.
output: Incredibly functional and easy to use!: This item was actually a bit of a shock to me.  I was expecting it to be functional, but wasn't sure exactly how functional it would be.  When I received the product I was surprised by how light it was.  That's nice for moving it around/storing it, but made me further question the durability.  Given the non-stick coating, I made to only use materials that would not scratch the surface (I have metal tongs with silicone ends, or I use wooden spoons).  I have cooked a number of things in the grillet, including chicken, steak, burgers, stir fry, and have also used it as a slow cooker.  In every case the food turned out exceptional - the non-stick surface is truly non-stick and the cooking is even (although be careful when using as a slow cooker as the heat coil cycles on and off, rather than steady state like a true slow cooker).  Clean-up is actually nothing short of a miracle - literally rinse with water and wipe with a paper towel.  Feel free to wash it with detergent etc., but not really needed.  The other benefit is that it doesn't heat up the house as much as using a stove or oven.  Overall I was impressed enough to purchase a second one for a mountain condo I own.  HIGHLY recommended

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'DSquared' to comment on the product 'FoodSaver 1-Pint Precut Vacuum Seal Bags with BPA-Free Multilayer Construction for Food Preservation, 28 Count, Clear'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 12.99; Brand: FOODSAVER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Vacuum Sealer Bags'.
output: Great for preserving food in single use portions!: These pint size bags are great for preserving produce from our garden- we always produce more bell peppers than we can use fresh.  I either cut them in strips or dice them and freeze them in these pint bags, which is perfect when we want to use them for a stir-fry or in soup, etc.  I was surprised at how they were not mushy when thawed, but still had some "body" to them.I have seen some complaints about how small these are....but they are great for when I just want to thaw out a small amount for a recipe, and not a whole quart that may then go bad before I use them all.  That would defeat the purpose of having a foodsaver....I also have used this size for freezing homemade chili in single serve portions.  For that, I load the chili into the bag, fold over the top and freeze it for a few hours, then seal it.  I have found that if I am sealing foods that have quite a bit of liquid in them I must freeze it first in the bag, or else the liquid is vacuumed out and no seal can form.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Ocinana' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: When I started cooking family dinners I looked at a lot of rice cookers hoping to find something similar to what my mom had - Th: I was just looking up some information about my rice cooker and it occurred to me that this is one of the few appliances I still really feel excited about.  I grew up eating rice from a Japanese rice cooker that my mom bought in the 1960's when my family was stationed there.  When I started cooking family dinners I looked at a lot of rice cookers hoping to find something similar to what my mom had - This is nothing like my mom's old cooker but the rice is just the same - actually I think it might be better. I use it for rice and for Trader Joe's whole grain oatmeal on the porridge setting.  It is amazing with whole grains.  I use the timer with the oatmeal, I set it to start cooking an hour before we get up in the morning and wake up to a hot breakfast!  I bought mine in 2009 and it still works as it did when I bought it, it is really well made.  It is super easy to clean too.  I really love this rice cooker and would recommend it to anyone.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Erica M' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: If you eat rice, you need this!: I’ve owned this for almost two years and it’s easily one of my most used kitchen appliances. I bought this to replace an old Aroma rice cooker that eventually came apart after a few years of near daily use. I eat a fair amount of medium grain rice, so more often than not this rice cooker stays on basic settings. When I  have ventured beyond white rice, it’s handled quinoa, porridge, mixed rice, and even frozen vegetables with ease. Regardless, it’s more than paid for itself on rice alone. This rice cooker certainly isn’t cheap, but it makes perfect rice every time, keeps the rice warm without drying it out, and is a breeze to clean and store away. It’s never burned the rice on the bottom or boiled over like cheaper cookers, and is still going strong despite regular abuse. If you eat rice regularly, save yourself the trouble and buy a Zo’—push button, get perfect rice, no fuss required.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Victor R.' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Perfect rice, but slow: If you're only making rice to put into a casserole or bury under some canned topping, this unit will be overkill.  OTOH, if you stock four or more different types of rice in your cupboard and/or want your rice done just perfectly, this is probably the unit for you. One caveat is that this unit is SLOW.  You'll get that perfect cup (note, their "cups" are really about 6oz, not a full 8oz) of rice, but it may take an hour.  Using the timer, planning ahead - no problem.  Last minute meal that you want done in 25 minutes - not so good.The only other major issue seems to be the (soldered in) battery.  I have read threads that recommend always leaving the unit plugged in, ostensibly to reduce the battery charge/discharge and hopefully extend the battery life. I'm only a year in on the unit, but will report back in a few years if this strategy helps/hurts.Otherwise, the units works just great and truly makes perfect rice (great steel cut oats as well).

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Ana' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: 1 min juice: I really don't like writing reviews, but this one is worth it!I received my juicer a week ago. Last year I purchased a much smaller juicer mainly to make celery juice but it took me like 15 mns to clean, so naturally I used it less and less until I gave it away.I don't give up easily though, so I decided to invest in my health again.My sister has a Breville, so I decided to go for it.This is what my third morning in a row looked like:8:00 am wash celery8:01 Juice a whole bunch (actually in like 30 seconds)8:02 pour in glass and drink it while washing parts8:05 DONE, all parts washed  by hand (I'm pretty sure they go in the dishwasher too).This is an AMAZING machine! It may not be a masticating juicer, and may not get ALL the juice out of the veggies but it's pretty darn close and this one I actually ENJOY using and washing, which makes it better than a higher quality masticating juicer collecting dust in the cabinet!I have also made carrot, apple, pear, ginger turmeric juice (just put the fresh turmeric in first so the rest of the ingredients clean the strong coloring of turmeric)

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Annie' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Great Time-saver: This rice cooker is made in Japan and works great.  It has 2 timers which I have set for the morning & suppertime.  My husband & I love steel cut oats which take a lot of time to cook.  I place the oats, water, flax seeds, chia seeds, crushed banana...etc in the rice cooker in the evening and set the timer and the porridge setting.  We get up in the morning and the porridge is being kept warm and is perfect.  We also love brown rice which never cooked right in my previous rice cooker.  Brown rice needs a lower temperature and longer cooking period.  This Zojirushi has many rice settings including the brown rice.  I rince and prepare my rice in the morning before work and set the timer for suppertime. When I come home from work, all I have to do is the meat & vegetables and my rice is ready and waiting.  The rice is always perfect.  I am really happy with this purchase.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Dee' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Consistent, Yummy, Easy: I used this rice cooker for the first time at a furnished house we were renting and it won me over with its flawless performance. When we bought our new place, I researched a variety of other brands (and even other models in the same brand). I decided on this one, and I'm once again impressed.  Consistency, great flavor and texture for a variety of types of rice, and fantastic ease of use (that is, once you understand that a "cup" is not a standard US cup but, rather, the clear plastic cup (or green plastic cup) that came with the machine).  No regrets at all for not having gotten the even-more-advanced model. I had to laugh when the other day our house cleaner, who's a lovely Chinese lady with super-strong consumer opinions,  complimented me on my choice of this product! She makes rice a lot more than I do and I take this as another confirmation that this rice cooker is a great choice. You'll love the keep-warm feature.

output: You won't be dissapointed!: I bought this for our travel trailer to use when we are hooked up to electricity in trailer parks instead of using up our propane for our stove. I set it up in our kitchen at home to give it a try and LOVE it!I use it almost every day. It browns food wonderfully and you use just a minimal amount of oil or butter in the bottom. It heats up quickly and maintains the temperature once you get the hang of adjusting the knob to the correct heat you need. It cooks very hot, so start off low when you first get it.With the non-stick surface, it is a breeze to clean. You just disconnect the plug-in, separate the black (cooking pan part) from the white holder and wash it in the sink in soapy water.I definitely recommend this pan!

output: LOVE it!!!: This is one of my all-time favorite Amazon products! We currently own two and use them several times a week for grilling chicken. This was a game changer in our household because it cooks meat so quickly - perfect for busy people who don’t have a ton of time to spend in the kitchen on weeknights. We bought our first one 4 or 5 years ago and it lasted probably 3 years until the coating on the pan started to wear away. We now own 2 more and have also bought them as gifts for family members. I have never used it as a hot pot, and rarely as a steamer, so I can’t attest to its usefulness there. But for grilling meat, especially chicken, I would highly recommend it. If you’re looking for an inexpensive and reliable grill to quickly and effortlessly cook your food, this one is PERFECT.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Priscilla T.' to comment on the product 'Presto 07211 Liddle Griddle'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 40.86; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Griddles'.
output: Great for traveling!: I seldom do product reviews.  But sometimes a product has been very helpful to me and sometimes I sort of  think that I should do a review -- it could maybe help somebody else. .  This is the case with this lirttle griddle.  I took it and a small electric hot water pot  in my airplane luggage on what was expected to be a  hard and long trip.  It was.  This little griddle is small and light.I stayed in a place that allowed cooking -- they actually had a  stove, but not a very good one and pots and pans did not come with the room.  Plus this little griddle  gets up to 400 degrees quickly .  Among many other things, it can make a great hamburger. It made my working trip much easier, cheaper and more pleasant.  I'm very glad I had it and I plan to bring it along if there are future trips.  I'm glad I had this little griddle when I needed it.  It worked great.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Yekaterina Kazhdan' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Makes delicious rice/grains and easy to use: I just got this amazing little rice cooker yesterday and I already love it! I've tested it with brown rice, and it was the most delicious brown rice I've ever eaten. I tested it with buckwheat todqy and it works with that also on the white rice setting. Cleaning it is super easy, so is operating this rice cooker. Just measure the rice, dump it in the pot, clean the rice and put the water level up to the handy marker that's already in it, put the little pot back in, turn it on and voila tasty rice and grains.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Christine P.' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: I love this new cooker: I have an old rice cooker for 20 years.  I had no idea what I was missing out.  When I cooked my short grain rice in the  old cooker, it was terrible, until this cooker.I know that there is the other induction cooker out there, but this one works just fine for me.  love the rice that came out from it short grain (Japanese rice) or long grain (Jasmine - Thai/Vietnamese rice).  When you use the pot if you don't select the quick cook - it takes longer - so, buffer in that time for when you should make rice - if you are in hurry, select the quick cook option.I know the music is a bit cheesy but I love it, it sings when it starts and it sings when it's done.  I also liked the looks of the pot, the round and smooth and elongate shape - like alien head - cute!

It also helps if the temperature is high enough as well. I hated losing the first one due to sticking! Haven't lost the first one in years. I use it a lot so remembering the position is not an issue but if you don't it might not be the one for you.

output: it was better. This juicer kind of loads up and then ...: Used an old Jack LaLanne Power Juicer every day for two years and honestly, it was better. This juicer kind of loads up and then just releases and spits out juice and pulp in one belch. The Power Juicer plunger would evenly descend through the feeder tube, juicing the whole time. They are designed basically the same and both are quick to break-down, clean and reassemble. This juicer is well made, has an easier cutting disc release and looks nice, but not worth the extra money.The Power Juicer's flaw was that after two years of every day use the blade dulled. Maybe performance varies from one microwave to the other but this one did not work well at all for us. The red version only takes about 3 minutes and leaves very few unpopped kernels. instruction: Please simulate consumer 'CR' to comment on the product 'Presto 04830 PowerPop Microwave Multi-Popper, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 24.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Popcorn Poppers'.
output: Fantastic popcorn popper!: I usually don't write too many product reviews but I really wanted to with this. I previously had a glass popper with a lid on it where you measured the kernels on the lid and then dropped them in. It always left a ton of un-popped kernels and I really mean a lot.I bought this just 2-3 days ago and I've used it three times already and each time I only had 3-4 un-popped kernels in a 1/3 cup. This is the best popcorn popper I have ever had. I've never had so little kernels left in the popper after I was done. The popcorn comes out fresh, hot and delicious and the plastic bowl and lid are simple to clean.It takes me about 2 minutes and thirty seconds to make the best popcorn I have ever made at home. I'm very impressed with this and happy with my purchase and for only fifteen dollars, it's priced very fairly. It comes with a pack of 8 concentrators which you put on the bottom of the bowl. I also bought two additional packs, so I have enough of them to last quite awhile. It's so simple to use and clean as well. I can highly recommend getting this Presto PowerPop if you love to make popcorn at home. I'm sorry I didn't know about this product years ago, but I'm glad I'm enjoying it now.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'JK' to comment on the product 'Presto 03430 Pizzazz Plus Rotating Oven, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 79.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Ovens & Toasters:Countertop Pizza Ovens'.
output: Works Perfectly...: In all likelihood, I'll be giving this away soon.  Not because it has any problems for me--it doesn't--but because I bought it solely out of curiosity after seeing it on YouTube.  I never ate any pizza until I got in college, 'cause I grew up in the sixties and pizza chains, etc., weren't in Texas where I was.  I like pizza all right, but I very seldom buy a frozen one, and never go to pizza restaurants.  All that aside, I did buy a few different frozen pies at the grocery store after Amazon delivered it.  Instructions were very simple, and it made great pies from frozen.  Great that the pie is visible all the time, unlike in the oven.  Also noticed immediately that unlike cooking a frozen pie in the oven, particular 'supreme' ones, there's no place for messy drips in the oven; if anything melts while cooking it's confined to the pan.  I don't mind at all not having an on/off switch, having owned percolators, popcorn poppers, egg cookers, rice cookers, and a bunch of other small appliances without one.  This is yet another great and relatively inexpensive small appliance from the folks at Presto.

output: Awesome Juicer: I had previous owned a Champion juicer, but had problems with the blades dulling and subsequently having to apply a lot of force to push my carrots through.  No such problem with this machine.  Also, I find juice extraction is much more thorough - I was amazed to get over a cup of juice from 4 good sized carrots!  THere is some preparation involved in cutting the vegetables and fruit down to size, but I don't find it that inconvenient. There is a small screen on the juice extraction piece that may need some scrubbing with a brush, but this screen is a lot smaller than that of the Champion and therefore cleans much more quickly.

Customer service told me not to make converted rice in it. I have so much of it that I will try it on the quick setting. It also supposedly makes oatmeal, but not other grains. I want to make risotto in it but have been told that I shouldn’t. I hope it won’t become another expensive appliance I do t use very much. The good part is that it is very easy to clean and very sturdy. This is not a cheap piece of junk. It is a beautiful machine. I just wish it made kasha, polenta etc.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Hammer Toe' to comment on the product 'BLACK+DECKER G48TD Waffle Maker, 3-in-1, Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 69.99; Brand: BLACK+DECKER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: Huge Disappointment: I had one of these that worked satisfactorily for more than 10 years.  So I figured that a new one would be just as good, right?  Wrong!  This new one is a huge disappointment and is headed to the garbage can.  Quality control is sadly lacking.  The thing holding the lower heating element sits too high to allow the lower plate to sit properly - it had to be forced down in order to sit properly but then the clip didn't hold it down.  It kept popping off the plate.  After bending the clip with pliers the clip held but sometimes would bump up against the clip for the upper plate preventing the plates from fitting together to properly.  The few times the clips held, the lower plate browned the waffle nicely but the upper plate did not, ever.  Back to the search for the elusive thin waffle maker.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Ruby Slippers 9' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: 15 Years and still like NEW!: I have had this fondue pot since my wedding day, 15 years ago. I am sitting here now on our 14th New Years Eve (just days shy of my 15th Anniversary and I'm making my 14th New Year's fondue dinner. Making fondue for New Years has been a tradition for the last 14 years and the pot is still working just the same as it did 14 years ago.  I will say that I dont actually use it for chocolate myself, but it works perfectly for cheese fondue, and broth for dinner. Love this pot!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Brian B' to comment on the product 'Presto 07211 Liddle Griddle'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 40.86; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Griddles'.
output: More efficient clean cooking compared to larger presto griddles: I am amazed by this liddle griddle.  I have found that you can cook cleaner and more efficiently than using a larger presto griddle.  I grew fed up with the cumbersome larger griddle that was too large for any cabinet, sink etc.  The plastic drip on larger units was difficult to clean in between the cracks.  This liddle dude solves all of that and then some.  You can almost buy two for the price of the larger one and keep the eggs separate from the pancakes when the kids won’t eat em due to a known cross cooking contamination.  Jokes aside, if you had two, eggs on one temp compared to making pancakes on the other giving more control on the cooking.  The integrated drip trough is great as well.  The only improvement I could be picky about is to make a cleaning spatula the shape of the drip trough for collecting and removing drippings so you can keep cooking easily.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Scott' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Makes oil fondues great again!: We used this at Christmas for an oil fondue we use to cook shrimp and filet tips. For the last sooooo many years we had an oil fondue with a fuel burner that just couldn't keep up. No matter what fuel we used it could never maintain enough heat to cook even 2 or 3 items at a time. So I had to keep running back and forth to the kitchen to heat up the oil that would last for a few pieces. I was really unsure how this Cuisinart would do.I am pleasantly surprised and happy to report this thing rocks! We just kept putting in piece after piece and it cooked in no time. I even turned the pot DOWN at one point! Keeping up with our cooking pace was the most important thing so it gets 5 starts based on that alone. I'm not entirely stoked that the unit is an all in one deal, you can't remove the pot from the base, but it's not a huge deal. Other people have recommended the other Cuisinart, the 1000 I think, but based on that fact it sits higher and has the condiment trays. My feeling is that those condiment trays are ugly and I wouldn't want them anyway, and the 3SS sits plenty high enough.Another feature I like is that the connection to the power cord is magnetic. Brilliant idea so that if someone gets tangled in the cord, the pot won't go over. The cord just quickly disconnects, great idea and much safer. Others complain about the bulky nature of the cord, which is somewhat true, but with a full table of plates, food, drinks, etc., I never noticed the cord and I was sitting next to it. The pot inside is non-stock making clean up very easy. It would be nice if it had a ring of condiment cups that looked decent to go along with it. Highly recommend this pot from someone who knows fondue.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Colette Wagholikar ' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Loved this juicer!!!!! 5 stars due to the amount of O2 on high speed, but other than that it's a win so far...: The Breville 800JEXL Juice Fountain Elite1000-Watt Juice ExtractorThis is one of my new centrifugal juicers that I plan to use on those harder fruits and vegetables.  This is TOP quality household brand I wanted to try out with Valley Girl to see if it is a brand I want to invest in when I open the shop.  I used this machine yesterday on everything except kale & wheatgrass, leaving those to the masticating machines.The two speeds are both powerful, with high being a bit louder, but oh so much more powerful.  Too fast actually, I juiced everything on low except the ginger.  I got tons of juice out of everything, but on high there was way more oxygen whipped out of it,  it was unnecessary until I got to the ginger.The machine itself is very sturdy and super easy to assemble.  This juicer was easier to clean than my smaller house Hamilton Beach centrifugal juicer and kept strong juicing for 4 hours.  I LOVED IT!!!Fast, medium noise level, a bit heavy but worth it, SO easy to clean, quality juice from every type of produce.  I will post again about this juicer after a few weeks with it...What I juiced yesterday on my Breville:Beets w/ greens,  Carrots, Red Cabbage, Oranges, Red & Green Apples, Pineapple, Cantalope, Lemons, Key Limes, & Ginger

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Fontaine' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Great machine!: Just a great machine. I have 5 other juicers, all top of the line, and the 800jexl is hands down the fastest, easiest to use and extracts the highest percentage of juice. Nutrifaster is better but more than $3000. And for the purists who think this machine will overheat the veggies and destroy the enzymes, only 1.5 degrees of temperature rise. No worries here. There are some reviews here that would steer you away but I would have to say that those folks must not follow the guidelines in the manual. The biggest drawback...if you don't do what the book says...is that your juicer will not juice so great. That is because the screen has gotten clogged. Results will be wet pulp. chunks of food, juice spraying out of everywhere, etc. The solution is easy! Keep the screen clean. DO NOT let the juice dry on the screen. Even thought the screen is supposed to be stainless it will clog and then rust almost shut. Clean the screen within minutes of finishing your juicing and it will work like a champ. If you mess up, there ain't no fixing it so go to ereplacements.com and buy a new one for $30.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Scott Sober' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart 4 Slice Toaster Oven, Brushed Stainless, CPT-180P1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 53.59; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Ovens & Toasters:Toasters'.
output: Horrible: There were so many brands out there we had never heard of, and in an effort to get a good quality toaster we chose to go with a brand we have always had good luck with.  I don't know if this product is representative of all Cuisinart products out there right now - but this one is junk.  The temperature control knobs are cheap.  The levers to lower the bread into the toaster are cheap and flimsy feeling.  When the toaster "pops" up - it basically just clicks and you have to manually raise it.  We have yet to have it actually lift up a normal piece of bread - let alone a bagel.  Choosing the bagel setting does nothing - it toasts both sides of the bagel the same - there is no difference.  Hoping we just got a lemon - but it is definitely going to be returned.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'D. Rodney' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: How to solve the boiling over issue: I've had this cooker for 5 years and only use it for cooking rice. I love it's good looks and confess that's what led me to choose this model. For the first two years I too experienced the boiling over of rice water all over the counter each time I used it. I resorted to placing newspaper and towels under the unit to catch the sticky mess. Not the best solution. I was ready to throw the monster out, but got on this site and read all the reviews first, hoping someone would mention a solution to the problem. And luckily, someone did!  All you have to do is to place the steel steaming tray on top of the pot, with the glass lid on top of that. Presto!  Never have I had another boil over. The glass lid doesn't seal tightly against the pot, thus allowing the boil over messes. The steel tray forms the perfect seal. It would surely be nice if the manufacturer would mention this very important point in the manual, don't ya think?  I now love the pot and have experienced no other problem with it.

output: Very fast and easy to use: Very fast and easy to use. Didn't find it that much larger than others despite other reviews. Considering that you use it for only a few minutes at a time, the noise level was very acceptable. Easy to clean. Would like to have a fine mesh strainer for the pitcher as the juice was covered with at least 2 inches of heavy froth and we had to let it sit several hours to get it mostly clear. Then we poured the remaining froth off and drank the clear juice. There was also sedimentation that would be cleared by the strainer. Well worth the extra money.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Melenzan' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Elite Juicer, Brushed Stainless Steel, 800JEXL'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 290.95; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output:
I'm convinced that this model does not offer the best value in 2015: Having owned this juicer for years, I'm convinced that this model does not offer the best value in 2015. There are two main issues. The first is that this model currently sells for twice the price of the Breville JE98XL. The second is that this model often creates a mess due to a design flaw. The design flaw is not just in my head as fixing it was the single biggest change Breville made when they subsequently designed the JE98XL. The flaw involves the topmost piece of the juicer which consists of the feed chute as well as a large clear plastic piece that forms the ceiling of the juicing area as well as the funnel to the waste bin. The issue is that this piece does not form a tight enough seal with the metal piece below it. If you only juice a glass or two of juice, it isn't really an issue. But I juice a couple days worth of juice at once and before long juice works its way through and starts dripping as well as sporadically spraying through this joint. This creates such an issue that I am forced to hang cut up produce bags on the wall and cabinet next to where I juice to catch the spray and save me the effort of scrubbing them off when I am done. In subsequent models, Breville decided to have these two pieces connect by having them overlap each other by 1"+ which seems to have fixed the issue. My girlfriend has the JE98XL, which is why I have had the chance to experience both.

On the plus side, the 800JEXL has a 1000 watt motor. Breville uses weaker motors in some of its other models (850 watts on the JE98XL). The difference is noticeable but not meaningful (unless juicing a carrot in 2 seconds instead of 3 is meaningful to you). Also, the 800JEXL uses a lot of steel components which look fantastic and show no signs of wear after a lot of use. This is superior to the JE98XL which uses steel colored plastic on the exterior.

In the end, the 800JEXL is a high quality juicer. But are you really going to pay twice the price for a product that makes a mess when the newer, cheaper, model doesn't?

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Rosebud' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Cooking crow in this rice cooker: OK, OK, my husband was right! We've been married for over 27 years, and it isn't that I mind being wrong - I just hate admitting he's right.I was a cook and have been making rice on the stove-top forever. During a dinner party, one of our guests asked why we didn't have a rice cooker. Well... that got my husband researching rice cookers. He read EVERY Amazon.com review as well as the Zojirushi website. You have no idea how bitterly I complained about "wasting" money on a rice cooker. Boy was I wrong. This rice cooker is awesome and makes really fabulous rice. Yes, the rice actually is more delectable.Some observations -Similar to coffee makers, the capacity refers to 6 oz cups. However, for best results, Zojirushi recommends using no more than 4 - 6 oz cups of dry rice SO this machine machine comfortably feeds 4 adults. If you plan on feeding more people or want leftovers, consider getting the larger capacity rice cooker.Hands down makes the best brown rice! It comes out perfectly and is delicious! We always knew brown rice was healthier, but just never liked it. Now, it is a regular part of our repertoire.If you've never had rice porridge, you are in for a real treat! You can set the rice cooker up in the evening to have the porridge ready in the morning. We often add thinly sliced black mushrooms and ginger. What a fabulous, healthy warm breakfast.I haven't even touched upon sticky rice or mixed grain recipes. Thus far, everything has come out perfectly. I wish I could say the same of some for my other cooking experiments!So, fair is fair. I'm eating crow and writing this review. I imagine my husband will bookmark this one. Purchasing the Zojirushi Fuzzy Logic Rice Cooker was money well spent. I highly recommend the machine and give it 8 out of 5 stars.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Bob Fliegel' to comment on the product 'Hamilton Beach DrinkMaster Electric Drink Mixer, Restaurant-Quality Retro Milkshake Maker & Milk Frother, 2 Speeds, Extra-Large 28 oz. Stainless Steel Cup, Classic Chrome'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Hamilton Beach; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Mixers:Stand Mixers'.
output: Don't expect the thickness you remember from your youth - UPDATE: I don't know why I deluded myself into thinking that this consumer version of the old soda fountain machines could actually produce a shake with the viscosity of those made by the latter. It clearly can't. What you get with a combo of very cold milk, chocolate ice cream, chocolate sauce, and malt powder is malted chocolate milk. And that's after following the included instructions to the letter. So, what to do? After mixing your combo up in this device, put the full metal cup in the freezer for an hour. That will approximate what you remember from lo those many years ago.UPDATE: Figured out how to make this produce a milk shake or malt with thicker and more authentic viscosity. Put the desired amount of milk in the metal cup, then put the cup in your freezer for an hour. After you add the ice cream (I zap for 10 secs) and other ingredients, turn the device on Lo and watch the contents closely. It will remain more like a shake/malt if you never turn it on Hi.
