instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Tedpr' to comment on the product 'Magic Bullet Blender, Small, Silver, 11 Piece Set'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 39.88; Brand: Magic Bullet; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Blenders:Countertop Blenders'.
output:
Not what they used to be....: Received mine today to replace my 15 year old Bullet whose motor finally expired. THE NEW ONES ARE NOT OF THE SAME QUALITY. The cups have much thinner plastic walls and bend if squeezed. The old ones were "dishwasher safe" where it is recommended to hand wash the new ones as they warn it will warp in a dishwashers sanitation mode. The motor base is half the weight of the old one and as a result creeps on the counter when used given the lack of bulk. The power cord is half the length and borderline too short. Instruction also warn to not operate for more than a minute at a time to avoid damage to the motor. The tabs on the cup and switch mechanism in the base do not engage as fluidy as the original Bullet.
If you are replacing your old Bullet you will be very disappointed. The ONLY reason to buy a Bullet vs another brand is to use the old cups and blades you already have.
I highly doubt this Bullet will last anywhere near the 15 years my original did.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Avid Reader' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Why Didn’t I Get This Sooner?: I always thought a rice cooker was primarily for steamed rice, something I’m not a big fan of. Just tried it tonight for the first time and made rice pilaf.  The recipe I used was for stovetop cooking and it said to cook for 18 minutes. I set the timer after I followed the basic instructions for the rice cooker. The timer went off but the rice cooker continued cooking. That’s because there was still liquid (chicken stock). See? That’s why you need a rice cooker! I always follow recipes and my rice is either undercooked, too soggy or too dry. No more! It was perfect. Fluffy, flavorful, fresh and healthy. No preservatives or high sodium seasoning packets. Just good tasting rice with fresh veggies, herbs and seasoning. For sure my new kitchen staple.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Dejah' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Temp cycles between scalding hot or off: Would not recommend purchasing, since the heating element is not reliable.Pros:Nice aesthetic compared to other fondue setsThe brushed stainless steel stays relatively clean lookingEasy to clean - the entire pot can go into the dishwasher tooNice and wide mouth of potNon-slip feetTear away magnetic cord - if someone accidentally tripped on the cord the pot will not go flyingCons:No matter what setting you set it at, the way the heating element works is that it’s super extra burn-your-cheese hot or off.  Depending on which setting you pick increases or reduces the time in between that it is off.  We set it to a 4 as the ‘optimal’ setting.  The cheese fondue would be cold for about 30 seconds , then burning for 30 seconds, and do that over and over again.  You’ll have to be there stirring it the entire time when it switches the heat back on, or your cheese will burn.  When the cheese is not burning, it gets cold and starts to firm up.Given the above issue, having a double boiler option may solve the problem, but an additional bowl is not included.The set comes with metal fondue forks, but it says you can’t let them touch the inside of the pot or it will scratch the coating.The cord is very short (for safety)

Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Great Fondue Pot!: I used used this pot the first time for cheese fondue  and was most impressed with the temperature control.  It was very consistent at the #3 setting--no adjusting needed. I would have given it 5 stars but for the somewhat flimsy and unstable fork rest.  This should be modified for a more secure fit.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Kristina M. Bell' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: I love this juicer: I love this juicer! Do yourself a favor and bypass the cheaper, centrifugal versions. I have owned several of those because they are cheaper, they all burn out quickly. The omega by far surpassed my expectations. It does take longer but you get more juice. It's quieter. I honestly think either version, masticating or centrifugal, the clean up can be meticulous and time-consuming, but I feel this is actually easier to clean because the film the pulp leaves isn't as prevalent. Also, because the juice does not oxidize you can make extra and keep it in the fridge a few days, so ultimately you save time. If you read other reviews, they will say how you have to cut up the produce more. This is true, but as I mentioned the centrifugal ones just burn up when you put larger pieces in them anyways. And that's just lazy! It's worth the extra effort of cutting the produce down if your taking the time to juice for the nutritional value. This also processes, grinds, and has attachments that you can make pasta and rolls with. Best juicer I ever bought, and I have owned 4.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Geezer' to comment on the product 'FoodSaver 1-Pint Precut Vacuum Seal Bags with BPA-Free Multilayer Construction for Food Preservation, 28 Count, Clear'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 12.99; Brand: FOODSAVER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Vacuum Sealer Bags'.
output: My Favorite Size: I like the bags because you don't have to measure and cut, and only have to seal one side.  I don't like to do anything in the kitchen, so anything that saves time and effort is for me.  You pay more for bags than rolls, but your time is worth something, too.  The pint bag is the one I use most for my husband and me, but I use some quart-size, too.  I have two sealers, a standard size which I seldom use, and an old short one which lives on the back of the counter taking up very little space.  Having it right there ready to use prompts me to use it much more often than if I had to get it out of the closet.  Note:  Your sealer may tell you to wait a certain number of seconds between sealing jobs and to only seal x-number of times at a time to prevent overheating.  Sealing too many things too fast will result in less secure seals.  This is one of the reasons I prefer having to seal only one side of an item, especially as my most common use is to buy big packages of meats and chicken breasts at Costco, seal them all up individually, and put them in the freezer.  This is by far the easiest and most convenient and cost-effective way for me to manage meals at home.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Dragonbrain' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Burned Rice; Wash By Hand; Returning: Three separate attempts to cook brown rice resulted in burned rice each time.  Final trial included adding twice as much water as the instructions indicated.  The inside cook pot would not come clean in the dishwasher and had to be washed by hand.  Unit made a mess by boiling over.  In the process of returning it.  We love everything else we have ever gotten that was a Cuisinart product; really disappointed.Notes: There is another review indicating that Cuisinart is no longer selling this product; if true, we can see why.  There are reviews on other products of this type ("automatic" rice cooker with a single button start) and the negative reviews on them note that when they say 4-Cup or 6-Cup, etc. they mean four or six of the little cups they include with the unit, not a standard measure.  This is deceptive and may be why we had trouble with this unit (there was a little plastic cup with the unit but we ignored it and did a single, English-measure cup of rice and appropriate water based on the instructions, but also based on our own experience); beware.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'David F. Hull' to comment on the product 'BLACK+DECKER G48TD Waffle Maker, 3-in-1, Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 69.99; Brand: BLACK+DECKER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: Top Reviewer Alan Mayer Explains It Beautifully: I, like Alan-- whose review is awesome-- long for the old days of the Toastmaster version, which I used on and off for almost 50 years. I bought this latest iteration a few years ago. My new wife found the greasiness, etc., of the old one too disgusting. She does not come from a waffle-making family. Obviously.Anyway: they've cost-reduced this design so much it's pathetic. The base is not as heavy as it used to be, giving me the sense that when I raise the lid all the way back, it may tip over. Alan's right that the plates are thinner and warp. The clips that hold the plates don't work as well as they used to.I wish Black and Decker would come out with a "Toastmaster Classic Waffle Iron" model that's the way they used to be made and charge $90 or $100 for it.  If they want to keep a lower price point with this overly-cost-reduced model, fine. But give us the Best Waffle Iron in the World Back!! It would be nice if it were made in North America, too, if you please.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Stan Graham' to comment on the product 'Aroma Housewares ASP-137 Grillet 3Qt. 3-in-1 Cool-Touch Electric Indoor Grill Portable, Dishwasher Safe, 3-Quart, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 31.1; Brand: Aroma Housewares; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Grills'.
output: I thought that was a good sign, I could sear steaks with no problem: I purchased this utensil because I am down to cooking for one, I have a Zojirushi Grill of the same type as the Aroma but it is much larger, too large for one person. The Aroma looked a more reasonable size and it was when I received it. So I decided to try it with something simple. I tested how hot it got and the thermometer showed well above the 400 degrees on the dial before it shut off. I thought that was a good sign, I could sear steaks with no problem. So next day I decided to do grilled potatoes and steak. I followed a recipe from the web for this grill. I set it to 400 and added the potatoes rubbed with oil, after a little while I noticed that the slight smoking had stopped so I measured the temp. it was down to 200+ degrees. Now I know that the temp swings attempting to keep a certain temp - but not 200 degrees.  It came back on a little later and moved higher in temp but not to 400. I cooked the potatoes for a while until they showed browning, then I added the steak. I appeared to sear the meat. So when it was done I removed it to a heated plate and added some water to the grill (as per the recipe) replaced the lid and steamed the potatoes. I then plated the potates and steak. I looked OK. However on tasting the meal it tasted heavily of plastic (the non-stick I suspect). Needless to say I am returning this product and will revert to my Jojirushi grill.Stan Graham

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Thomas Jefferson' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: Love this juicer!: There is nothing about this juicer that I don't like. It really takes the juice out and the pulp is so much drier than my old centrifugal juicer.We've been using this several times a day and hubs and I are feeling much healthier.Cleanup is a snap, the parts are easy to remove and put back together.The auger has a metal rod that fits into a metal hole into the motor part of the juicer. This is very important, because if it were made of plastic, the life of the juicer would be questionable at best.I've juiced soft items like papaya and honeydew, they tend to clog a bit, but if you take the plunger and pull it up and down in the feeder hole, the juice comes out. Or if you use a harder item, like carrots afterward, it'll push out what gets stuck inside. It's not a big deal at all.The juice comes out cold if the fruits and veggies have been refrigerated before juicing them. It was never cold when it came out of my centrifugal juicer.This is such an excellent deal. I'm glad I found out about masticating juicers and this one is great for the price, free shipping can't be beat. It arrived quickly and the packaging is great.If you are looking for a great juicer with a very moderate price tag, this is the one.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'L. Cook' to comment on the product 'Zojirushi NS-ZCC10 Neuro Fuzzy Cooker, 5.5-Cup uncooked rice / 1L, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 209.99; Brand: Zojirushi; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: A bit pricey, scared to spend that much, but really glad I did.: This is a very versatile rice cooker, and I have still not found all the ways to use it. I was very hesitant to spend that much money on a rice cooker, as I have always used the cheaper, off the shelf models before. However, the variety of functions and the keep warm function have sold me. It takes some commitment if you want to explore all the ways to use it, but you really won't be sorry. I have some limited mobility because of health issues, and I can put supper together in the morning, while I feel good, and then by evening, when I don't feel so well, it is all waiting for me. I am satisfied my money was well spent. I do recommend getting a good rice cooker cookbook, such as the "Ultimate Rice Cooker Cookbook" by Hensperger and Kaufman, to go with it. And no, I don't get any kickback. I just have gotten lots of good ideas from it. I especially like the Hagai Mai rice I've cooked in it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Mark Kowaleski' to comment on the product 'Proctor Silex Easy Slice Electric Knife for Carving Meats, Poultry, Bread, Crafting Foam and More, Lightweight with Contoured Grip, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 19.61; Brand: Proctor Silex; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Electric Utensils:Electric Knives'.
output: Not like the old days!: We had the same electric knife 25 years ago. Tried this and it is not even close to the electric knife I remember. It is awkward to hold and even more awkward to keep the power button pressed while also pressing down to slice something. Bought it mostly for homemade bread and Costco sourdough bread, which tends to be a dense and sticky bread with a hard crust. This electric knife is absolutely terrible at cutting that kind of  bread. The blade seems very dull to me, and flimsy. It is also difficult to remove the blade for cleaning - you have to struggle with it and risk getting cut. Back it went. in contrast, I have been using my trusty Henckel's serrated bread knife for the last 25 years and, as it turns out, it is working just fine! So, I am going to stick with the old tried and true non-electric serrated bread knife. Plus, nothing to break or plug in. It just works.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Shadow22' to comment on the product 'Aroma Housewares ASP-137 Grillet 3Qt. 3-in-1 Cool-Touch Electric Indoor Grill Portable, Dishwasher Safe, 3-Quart, White'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 31.1; Brand: Aroma Housewares; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Indoor Grills & Griddles:Electric Grills'.
output: Does everthing I ask of it and does't complain!: While it is not perfect for all types of cooking, what it is designed for it excels with relatively slow, moist results. Never have to use "high" heating and seldom even medium. Cook most meals in the "warm" to "300" settings. Meat/vegetable combos cook grilled tender. Bacon slow crisp. Thick crust frozen pizza was perfect.Clean up has been a breeze.It is a grill surface, electric hot plate, no flat bottom surface, don't expect pancakes!  But, its the "Cadillac" of hotplates with a moisture  preserving cover.We cook with electric range/oven, outdoor propane, microwave, and induction surface, but still use this half the time.For what it is intended, it is a 5 Star, well worth the price and more.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Coala Bear' to comment on the product 'Waring Pro Professional Meat Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 320.0; Brand: Waring; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Food Grinders & Mills:Meat Grinders'.
output: Not up to the job, gears broke in under 2 weeks: I bought this grinder in Canada for $149 to grind raw chicken necks and backs for our dog.I never seriously stressed this grinder, but in under 2 weeks the internal gears actually broke.  It's as if there are low grade metal gears inside to help save money.The bones are all non-load baring bones, that are part of the chicken necks and backs, bones I can normally cut with a knife.Needless to say, I'm disappointed, and I recommend people get an ordinary hand grinder, the ones with the big long handles.I simply don't trust any manufacturers with the fluff they stuff inside these boxes.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'DrgnFly' to comment on the product 'FoodSaver 1-Pint Precut Vacuum Seal Bags with BPA-Free Multilayer Construction for Food Preservation, 28 Count, Clear'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 12.99; Brand: FOODSAVER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Vacuum Sealer Bags'.
output: Great product when used properly: Great product when used properly...I have no negative feelings at all. BUT...I am seriously concerned about the extreme disparity in the pricing of these FoodSaver bags (28 count pint bags). If I order one (1) box it is $0.30 per bag. If I order a 2 pack from the same seller it is $0.44 per bag. If I buy a 4 pack it is $0.42 cents per bag. Seems to me ordering 5 single packs would make more sense even if it costs Amazon more to pack and ship that a pre-packed 2 or 4 pack order. IMHO.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Michelle Pineda' to comment on the product 'Breville Juice Fountain Compact Juicer, Silver, BJE200XL, 10" x 10.5" x 16"'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 138.07; Brand: Breville; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Centrifugal Juicers'.
output: Simple to use: As long as you read instructions and are mindful of what you’re doing while using the juicer, you shouldn’t have any problems. People have mentioned leakage but it’s probably from the movement of the cup while placing items in the juicer. You need to make sure the cup stays flush against the juicer which is curved just right to fit the cup the entire time. It also helps to tilt the container to ensure that all liquid is drained into the cup. It’s also super fast! I stay with the urge to juice more things and will oftentimes find myself searching my kitchen for more fruits and veggies.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Christi' to comment on the product 'Presto 05450 DualDaddy Electric Deep Fryer, Black'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 44.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Fryers:Deep Fryers'.
output: it's ok, but I'd get something else: I've had this fryer for over 4 years.  It's held up fine, but doesn't have any of the features I think are important in a fryer.  The metal divider is ok, but I never use it as I find the 2 compartments too small.  The lid is worthless.  My roommate accidentally plugged it in instead of a different appliance and the lid melted right off in just a few minutes (a replacement lid is ridiculously priced after shipping, so I just use foil, but it's a pain). There are no temperature controls.  I bought a candy thermometer and the oil gets off the charts on the thermometer all the time.  I wish it were easier to control.  Also the outside gets very very hot. I've burned myself accidentally bumping into it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'J. Sacher' to comment on the product 'Omega Nutrition Center Juicer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 279.98; Brand: Omega; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Juicers:Masticating Juicers'.
output: Should not have wasted money on cheaper juicer: I bought a cheaper centrifugal juicer at first and that was a waste of money.  This is all we use now and it is surprisingly easier to clean that the other juicer.  It doesn't seem so at first, but with less actual screen area, it is easier to get that clean (the most tedious part of cleaning any juicer.)My only complaint is that the auger is less true than I would like.  But it hasn't caused a problem with function.  We have used the grinder functionality for making refried beans directly from canned pintos and making nut butters.  That works well.  I have not tried to make pasta with it yet.  I'm used to using a pasta roller, but look forward to trying this out.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Rob Moses' to comment on the product 'BLACK+DECKER G48TD Waffle Maker, 3-in-1, Silver'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 69.99; Brand: BLACK+DECKER; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Waffle Irons'.
output: Dangerous product: While the concept of the 3 in one waffle maker. griddle by Black and Decker is ideal, my experience with the product is disappointing and continued use is likely to prove dangerous.  Basically the removable plates do not stay secure.  I have had a waffle plate fall on top of the bottom one twice while heating.When I used the griddle flat, the plates slide around when you try to flip pancakes etc, exposing the coils which are hot.I really had wanted what I thought would be a versatile product.  Instead I find I spent a lot of money on a product I am afraid to use because of the danger of being burnt by falling or sliping grids.  Please note that I double check that the plates are held securely each time, but the mechanisms are just not tight no matter what I do with it.The plates also discolored on the griddle side with high heat and it did not hold the temperature well.  It took forever to make pancakes.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'k chim' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart CRC-400P1 4 Cup Rice Cooker, Stainless Steel Exterior'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 49.99; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Rice Cookers'.
output: Messy Old Design: You’re paying for a brand name made by a liscensee who is giving you 1980s design. The lid is glass with a vent. When the water boils the bubbles will escape through the home and along the edges of the lid. Cleaning is horrible as a result where the lid has a tiny space where all the rice water accumulates and the rice cooker is sprayed with the escaped steam & rice starch. I would not recommend this design and brand for a rice cooker. New design is with a closed lid and with a space plate to mitigate the escaped steam and splatter.If you don’t cook rice too much but would like to complement you Cuisinart kitchen gadgets it would be your decision to look pretty for open house etc. But this is really not for frequent cooking rice given the time to clean up after it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Rebecca Rogers' to comment on the product 'Presto Poplite 04820 Popper, 1 Size, yellow'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 29.99; Brand: Presto; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Popcorn Poppers'.
output: Poor design, but makes great popcorn: I had a similar product from this company for 40 years. It was starting to slow down. I bought this updated one. But BEWARE; the design can be dangerous for users. All top pieces, yellow and clear, get extremely hot. The top does not attach securely to the bottom piece. Can be bumped and fall off during use. The front piece where the popcorn comes out is so wide that a very large bowl is needed to catch all the popcorn. The heat blower is so strong that the unpopped kernals come out of the spout super fast and are also extremely hot. One such seed landed six feet away next to a crawling infant; I'm glad I beat him to pick it up.  All that said, with caution during use, I imagine this popper will last as long as the last one. I will keep it.

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'M. Forgione' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Fantastic fondue pot!: This fondue pot is great.  It heats up quickly and definitely puts out enough heat.  Start off lower and raise as needed.  I've tried chocolate and cheese.  Make sure to look up fondue recipes.  I had to add milk.it starts off thin and thickens as it warms.  I love this pot!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Angela C. Owen' to comment on the product 'Cuisinart Fondue Pot, 3 Quart, For Chocolate, Cheese, Broth, Oil, Stainless Steel, CFO-3SSP1'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 63.08; Brand: Cuisinart; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Electric Fondue Pots'.
output: Cheese/Chocolate: I did a lot of research on fondue pots.  Have eaten at The Melting Pot countless times, asked lots of questions...  I chose this pot because of the reviews. This pot keeps a regulated temperature perfectly!  I made a chocolate fondue - absolutely no problems.  I also made a spinach/artichoke cheese fondue.  I had one issue with it.  Definitely could have been an error on my part, but I never could get the cheese and the broth to completely mix.  The center of the pot would be the right consistency, but the outer edges were pure liquid.  Again, it could be the combo of cheeses I used or something, cause the chocolate worked excellent!

instruction: Please simulate consumer 'Kindle Customer' to comment on the product 'Waring Pro Professional Meat Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel'. No more than 20 words. Product price: 320.0; Brand: Waring; NodeLabelPath: 'Home & Kitchen:Kitchen & Dining:Small Appliances:Specialty Appliances:Food Grinders & Mills:Meat Grinders'.
output: Great grinder for homemade pet food: I just made 10# of raw cat food and this grinder ROCKS!  Absolutely no problem what-so-ever grinding boes, skin and meat.  I used 10# raw chicken and the worst part was cutting up the chickens.  This grinder didn't hesitate once during the whole process.  Clean up was easier than I expected and the machine is relatively easy to take apart to get clean.  If you are committed to making raw dog and cat food, this grinder would serve you well.
